Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this method to either force or stop an autoload or to control the internal name.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalWall.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to modify the properties of any wall in the game. Most properties are stored as arrays throughout the Terraria code.

member.summary: Allows you to customize which sound you want to play when the wall at the given coordinates is hit. Return false to stop the game from playing its default sound for the wall. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalWall.NumDust(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change how many dust particles are created when the wall at the given coordinates is hit.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalWall.RandomUpdate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.BackupIO.Player.WriteLocalFiles(Ionic.Zip.ZipFile,System.String)

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader
member.summary: This serves as the central class from which item-related functions are carried out. It also stores a list of mod items by ID.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the ModItem instance corresponding to the specified type. Returns null if no modded item has the given type.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.PrefixChance(Terraria.Item,System.Int32,Terraria.Utilities.UnifiedRandom)
member.summary: Allows for blocking, forcing and altering chance of prefix rolling. False (block) takes precedence over True (force). Null gives vanilla behaviour

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.CanUseItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Returns the "and" operation on the results of ModItem.CanUseItem and all GlobalItem.CanUseItem hooks. Does not fail fast (every hook is called).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.UseStyle(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Calls ModItem.UseStyle and all GlobalItem.UseStyle hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.HoldStyle(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the player is not holding onto a rope and is not in the middle of using an item, calls ModItem.HoldStyle and all GlobalItem.HoldStyle hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.HoldItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Calls ModItem.HoldItem and all GlobalItem.HoldItem hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.GetHealLife(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Calls ModItem.GetHealLife, then all GlobalItem.GetHealLife hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.UpdateArmorSet(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: If the head's ModItem.IsArmorSet returns true, calls the head's ModItem.UpdateArmorSet. This is then repeated for the body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsArmorSet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.UpdateArmorSet with that string.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.PreUpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the player's head texture's IsVanitySet returns true, calls the equipment texture's PreUpdateVanitySet. This is then repeated for the player's body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsVanitySet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.PreUpdateVanitySet, using player.head, player.body, and player.legs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.UpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the player's head texture's IsVanitySet returns true, calls the equipment texture's UpdateVanitySet. This is then repeated for the player's body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsVanitySet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.UpdateVanitySet, using player.head, player.body, and player.legs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.ArmorSetShadows(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the player's head texture's IsVanitySet returns true, calls the equipment texture's ArmorSetShadows. This is then repeated for the player's body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsVanitySet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.ArmorSetShadows, using player.head, player.body, and player.legs.

member.summary: Calls EquipTexture.SetMatch, then all GlobalItem.SetMatch hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.CanRightClick(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Calls ModItem.CanRightClick, then all GlobalItem.CanRightClick hooks, until one of the returns true. If one of the returns true, returns Main.mouseRight. Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.RightClick(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If Main.mouseRightRelease is true, the following steps are taken: 1. Call ModItem.RightClick 2. Calls all GlobalItem.RightClick hooks 3. Call ItemLoader.ConsumeItem, and if it returns true, decrements the item's stack 4. Sets the item's type to 0 if the item's stack is 0 5. Plays the item-grabbing sound 6. Sets Main.stackSplit to 30 7. Sets Main.mouseRightRelease to false 8. Calls Recipe.FindRecipes.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod
member.summary: Mod is an abstract class that you will override. It serves as a central place from which the mod's contents are stored. It provides methods for you to use or override.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.File
member.summary: The TmodFile object created when tModLoader reads this mod.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Code
member.summary: The assembly code this is loaded when tModLoader loads this mod.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Logger
member.summary: A logger with this mod's name for easy logging.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Name
member.summary: Stores the name of the mod. This name serves as the mod's identification, and also helps with saving everything your mod adds. By default this returns the name of the folder that contains all your code and stuff.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.tModLoaderVersion
member.summary: The version of tModLoader that was being used when this mod was built.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Version
member.summary: This version number of this mod.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Side
member.summary: The ModSide that controls how this mod is synced between client and server.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name of this mod in the Mods menu.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddItem(System.String,Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem)
member.summary: Adds a type of item to your mod with the specified internal name. This method should be called in Load. You can obtain an instance of ModItem by overriding it then creating an instance of the subclass.
member.exception: You tried to add 2 ModItems with the same name: " + name + ". Maybe 2 classes share a classname but in different namespaces while autoloading or you manually called AddItem with 2 items of the same name.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GetItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the ModItem instance corresponding to the name. Because this method is in the Mod class, conflicts between mods are avoided. Returns null if no ModItem with the given name is found.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GetItem``1
member.summary: Same as the other GetItem, but assumes that the class name and internal name are the same.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ItemType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the internal ID / type of the ModItem corresponding to the name. Returns 0 if no ModItem with the given name is found.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ItemType``1
member.summary: Same as the other ItemType, but assumes that the class name and internal name are the same.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddGlobalItem(System.String,Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem)
member.summary: Adds the given GlobalItem instance to this mod with the provided name.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GetGlobalItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the GlobalItem instance with the given name from this mod.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GetGlobalItem``1
member.summary: Same as the other GetGlobalItem, but assumes that the class name and internal name are the same.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddEquipTexture(Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem,Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an equipment texture of the specified type, internal name, and associated item to your mod. (The item parameter may be null if you don't want to associate an item with the texture.) You can then get the ID for your texture by calling EquipLoader.GetEquipTexture, and using the EquipTexture's Slot property. If the EquipType is EquipType.Body, make sure that you also provide an armTexture and a femaleTexture. Returns the ID / slot that is assigned to the equipment texture.
member.param: The female texture (for body slots), if missing the regular body texture is used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddEquipTexture(Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture,Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem,Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an equipment texture of the specified type, internal name, and associated item to your mod. This method is different from the other AddEquipTexture in that you can specify the class of the equipment texture, thus allowing you to override EquipmentTexture's hooks. All other parameters are the same as the other AddEquipTexture.
member.param: The female texture (for body slots), if missing the regular body texture is used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GetEquipTexture(System.String,Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType)
member.summary: Gets the EquipTexture instance corresponding to the name and EquipType. Returns null if no EquipTexture with the given name and EquipType is found.

member.summary: Gets the slot/ID of the equipment texture corresponding to the given name. Returns -1 if no EquipTexture with the given name is found.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GetAccessorySlot(System.String,Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType)
member.summary: Same as GetEquipSlot, except returns the number as an sbyte (signed byte) for your convenience.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddMusicBox(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to tie a music ID, and item ID, and a tile ID together to form a music box. When music with the given ID is playing, equipped music boxes have a chance to change their ID to the given item type. When an item with the given item type is equipped, it will play the music that has musicSlot as its ID. When a tile with the given type and Y-frame is nearby, if its X-frame is >= 36, it will play the music that has musicSlot as its ID.
member.exception: Cannot assign music box to vanilla music ID " + musicSlot or Music ID " + musicSlot + " does not exist or Cannot assign music box to vanilla item ID " + itemType or Item ID " + itemType + " does not exist or Cannot assign music box to vanilla tile ID " + tileType or Tile ID " + tileType + " does not exist
Music ID " + musicSlot + " has already been assigned a music box or Item ID " + itemType + " has already been assigned a music or or Y-frame must be divisible by 36

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.SetupAssetRepository(System.Collections.Generic.IList{ReLogic.Content.Sources.IContentSource},ReLogic.Content.AssetReaderCollection,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Type})
member.summary: Override this only if you know what you're doing. This hook can be used allow your mod to natively use assets from somewhere else but its .tmod file, or for registering asset readers.
member.param: The list with content sources. By default, this list has 1 entry with the default content source that loads assets from the mod's .tmod file.
The AssetReaderCollection that will be used for this mod's Assets repository. Use its .RegisterReader() method to register new 'IAssetReader's.
This list contains types that the asynchronous asset loader should delay loading of. Types like that are usually graphics related.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Load
member.summary: Override this method to add most of your content to your mod. Here you will call other methods such as AddItem. This is guaranteed to be called after all content has been autoloaded.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.PostSetupContent
member.summary: Allows you to load things in your mod after its content has been setup (arrays have been resized to fit the content, etc).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Unload
member.summary: This is called whenever this mod is unloaded from the game. Use it to undo changes that you've made in Load that aren't automatically handled (for example, modifying the texture of a vanilla item). Mods are guaranteed to be unloaded in the reverse order they were loaded in.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ExtraPlayerBuffSlots
member.summary: The amount of extra buff slots this mod desires for Players. This value is checked after Mod.Load but before Mod.PostSetupContent. The actual number of buffs the player can use will be 22 plus the max value of all enabled mods. In-game use Player.MaxBuffs to check the maximum number of buffs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddRecipeGroups
member.summary: Override this method to add recipe groups to this mod. You must add recipe groups by calling the RecipeGroup.RegisterGroup method here. A recipe group is a set of items that can be used interchangeably in the same recipe.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddRecipes
member.summary: Override this method to add recipes to the game. It is recommended that you do so through instances of ModRecipe, since it provides methods that simplify recipe creation.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.PostAddRecipes
member.summary: This provides a hook into the mod-loading process immediately after recipes have been added. You can use this to edit recipes added by other mods.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Close
member.summary: Close is called before Unload, and may be called at any time when mod unloading is imminent (such as when downloading an update, or recompiling) Use this to release any additional file handles, or stop streaming music. Make sure to call `base.Close()` at the end May be called multiple times before Unload

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ModifyTransformMatrix(Terraria.Graphics.SpriteViewMatrix@)
member.summary: Allows you to set the transformation of the screen that is drawn. (Translations, rotations, scales, etc.)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.UpdateUI(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary: Ran every update and suitable for calling Update for UserInterface classes

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.PreUpdateEntities
member.summary:
Use this if you want to do something before anything in the World gets updated. Called after UI updates, but before anything in the World (Players, NPCs, Projectiles, Tiles) gets updated.
When is true or is 0 or 2, the game may do a partial update. This means that it only updates menus and some animations, but not the World or Entities. This hook - and every hook after it - only gets called on frames with a full update.
If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdatePlayerNPC
member.summary:
Called after Players got updated, but before any NPCs get updated.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdateNPCGore
member.summary:
Called after NPCs got updated, but before any Gores get updated.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdateGoreProjectile
member.summary:
Called after Gores got updated, but before any Projectiles get updated.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdateProjectileItem
member.summary:
Gets called immediately after all Projectiles are updated, but before any Items get updated.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdateItemDust
member.summary:
Called after Items got updated, but before any Dust gets updated.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdateDustTime
member.summary:
Called after Dust got updated, but before Time (day/night, events, etc.) gets updated.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdateTimeWorld
member.summary:
Called after Time got updated, but before the World gets updated.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook a later part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MidUpdateInvasionNet
member.summary:
Called after Invasions got updated. The only thing that is updated after this is the Network.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see . If you are looking to hook even after the Network is updated, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.PostUpdateEverything
member.summary:
Called after the Network got updated, this is the last hook that happens in an update.
If you are looking to hook an earlier part of the update process, see .

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ModifyInterfaceLayers(System.Collections.Generic.List{Terraria.UI.GameInterfaceLayer})
member.summary: Allows you to modify the elements of the in-game interface that get drawn. GameInterfaceLayer can be found in the Terraria.UI namespace. Check https://github.com/tModLoader/tModLoader/wiki/Vanilla-Interface-layers-values for vanilla interface layer names

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ModifyLightingBrightness(System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify overall brightness of lights. Can be used to create effects similiar to what night vision and darkness (de)buffs give you. Values too high or too low might result in glitches. For night vision effect use scale 1.03

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.PostDrawInterface(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary:
Called after interface is drawn but right before mouse and mouse hover text is drawn. Allows for drawing interface.
Note: This hook should no longer be used. It is better to use the ModifyInterfaceLayers hook.

member.summary: Each background style determines in its own way how exactly the background is drawn. This class serves as a collection of functions for underground backgrounds.

member.summary: The mod that added this underground background style.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModUgBgStyle.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this underground background style.

member.summary: The ID of this underground background style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModUgBgStyle.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a ModUgBgStyle instead of using Mod.AddUgBgStyle. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this to either force or stop an autoload, or change the name that identifies this type of ModUgBgStyle.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModUgBgStyle.ChooseBgStyle
member.summary: Whether or not the conditions have been met for this background style to draw its backgrounds. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModUgBgStyle.FillTextureArray(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Allows you to determine which textures make up the background by assigning their background slots/IDs to the given array. Mod.GetBackgroundSlot may be useful here. Index 0 is the texture on the border of the ground and sky layers. Index 1 is the texture drawn between rock and ground layers. Index 2 is the texture on the border of ground and rock layers. Index 3 is the texture drawn in the rock layer. The border images are 160x16 pixels, and the others are 160x96, but it seems like the right 32 pixels of each is a duplicate of the far left 32 pixels.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle
member.summary: Each background style determines in its own way how exactly the background is drawn. This class serves as a collection of functions for above-ground backgrounds.

member.summary: The ID of this surface background style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a ModSurfaceBgStyle instead of using Mod.AddSurfaceBgStyle. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this to either force or stop an autoload, or change the name that identifies this type of ModSurfaceBgStyle.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle.ChooseBgStyle
member.summary: Whether or not the conditions have been met for this background style to draw its backgrounds. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle.ModifyFarFades(System.Single[],System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the transparency of all background styles that exist. In general, you should move the index equal to this style's slot closer to 1, and all other indexes closer to 0. The transitionSpeed parameter is what you should add/subtract to each element of the fades parameter. See the ExampleMod for an example.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle.ChooseFarTexture
member.summary: Allows you to determine which texture is drawn in the very back of the background. Mod.GetBackgroundSlot may be useful here, as well as for the other texture-choosing hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle.ChooseMiddleTexture
member.summary: Allows you to determine which texture is drawn in the middle of the background.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle.PreDrawCloseBackground(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Gives you complete freedom over how the closest part of the background is drawn. Return true for ChooseCloseTexture to have an effect; return false to disable tModLoader's own code for drawing the close background.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBgStyle.ChooseCloseTexture(System.Single@,System.Double@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine which texture is drawn in the closest part of the background. This also lets you modify the scale and parallax (as well as two unfortunately-unknown parameters).

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle
member.summary: This class serves to collect functions that operate on any kind of background style, without being specific to one single background style.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle.mod
member.summary: That mod that added this global background style.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this global background style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a GlobalBgStyle instead of using Mod.AddGlobalBgStyle. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this to either force or stop an autoload, or change the name that identifies this type of GlobalBgStyle.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle.ChooseUgBgStyle(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change which underground background style is being used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle.ChooseSurfaceBgStyle(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change which surface background style is being used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle.FillUgTextureArray(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Allows you to change which textures make up the underground background by assigning their background slots/IDs to the given array. Index 0 is the texture on the border of the ground and sky layers. Index 1 is the texture drawn between rock and ground layers. Index 2 is the texture on the border of ground and rock layers. Index 3 is the texture drawn in the rock layer. The border images are 160x16 pixels, and the others are 160x96, but it seems like the right 32 pixels of each is a duplicate of the far left 32 pixels.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBgStyle.ModifyFarSurfaceFades(System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the transparency of all background styles that exist. The style parameter is the current style that is being used.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff
member.summary: This class serves as a place for you to define a new buff and how that buff behaves.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.mod
member.summary: The mod that added this ModBuff.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this type of buff.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.Type
member.summary: The buff id of this buff.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.DisplayName
member.summary: The translations of this buff's display name.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.Description
member.summary: The translations of this buff's description.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.longerExpertDebuff
member.summary: If this buff is a debuff, setting this to true will make this buff last twice as long on players in expert mode. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.canBeCleared
member.summary: Whether or not it is always safe to call Player.DelBuff on this buff. Setting this to false will prevent the nurse from being able to remove this debuff. Defaults to true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.Autoload(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically load a buff instead of using Mod.AddBuff. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name and texture is initialized to the namespace and overriding class name with periods replaced with slashes. Use this method to either force or stop an autoload, and to change the default display name and texture path.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.SetDefaults
M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.Update(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to make this buff give certain effects to the given player. If you remove the buff from the player, make sure the decrement the buffIndex parameter by 1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.Update(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to make this buff give certain effects to the given NPC. If you remove the buff from the NPC, make sure to decrement the buffIndex parameter by 1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.ReApply(Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows to you make special things happen when adding this buff to a player when the player already has this buff. Return true to block the vanilla re-apply code from being called; returns false by default. The vanilla re-apply code sets the buff time to the "time" argument if that argument is larger than the current buff time.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.ReApply(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows to you make special things happen when adding this buff to an NPC when the NPC already has this buff. Return true to block the vanilla re-apply code from being called; returns false by default. The vanilla re-apply code sets the buff time to the "time" argument if that argument is larger than the current buff time.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBuff.ModifyBuffTip(System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the tooltip that displays when the mouse hovers over the buff icon, as well as the color the buff's name is drawn in.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType
member.summary: A flag enum representing context where this command operates.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.Chat
member.summary: Command can be used in Chat in SP and MP.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.Server
member.summary: Command is executed by server in MP.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.Console
member.summary: Command can be used in server console during MP.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.World
member.summary: Command can be used in Chat in SP and MP, but executes on the Server in MP. (singleplayer ? Chat : Server)

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandCaller.Player
member.summary: The Player object corresponding to the Player that invoked this command. Use this when the Player is needed. Don't use Main.LocalPlayer because that would be incorrect for various CommandTypes.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandCaller.Reply(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Use this to repond to the Player that invoked this command. This method handles writing to the console, writing to chat, or sending messages over the network for you depending on the CommandType used. Avoid using Main.NewText, Console.WriteLine, or NetMessage.SendChatMessageToClient directly because the logic would change depending on CommandType.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand
member.summary: This class represents a chat or console command. Use the CommandType to specify the scope of the command.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.mod
member.summary: The Mod this ModCommand belongs to.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.Name
member.summary: Internal name of this command.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.Command
member.summary: The desired text to trigger this command.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.Type
member.summary: A flag enum representing context where this command operates.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.Usage
member.summary: A short usage explanation for this command.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.Description
member.summary: A short description of this command.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Autoload this command, defaults to Mod.Properties.Autoload.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCommand.Action(Terraria.ModLoader.CommandCaller,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: The code that is executed when the command is triggered.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent
member.summary: Manages content added by mods. Liasons between mod content and Terraria's arrays and oversees the Loader classes.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.GetFileBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the byte representation of the file with the specified name. The name is in the format of "ModFolder/OtherFolders/FileNameWithExtension". Throws an ArgumentException if the file does not exist.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether or not a file with the specified name exists.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.GetTexture(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the texture with the specified name. The name is in the format of "ModFolder/OtherFolders/FileNameWithoutExtension". Throws an ArgumentException if the texture does not exist. If a vanilla texture is desired, the format "Terraria/FileNameWithoutExtension" will reference an image from the "terraria/Content/Images" folder. Note: Texture2D is in the Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics namespace.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.TextureExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether or not a texture with the specified name exists.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.TryGetTexture(System.String,ReLogic.Content.Asset{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D}@)
member.summary: Returns whether or not a texture with the specified name exists. texture will be populated with null if not found, and the texture if found.
member.param: The texture name that is requested
The texture itself will be output to this
member.returns: True if the texture is found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.GetSound(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the sound with the specified name. The name is in the same format as for texture names. Throws an ArgumentException if the sound does not exist. Note: SoundEffect is in the Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio namespace.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.SoundExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether or not a sound with the specified name exists.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.GetMusic(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the music with the specified name. The name is in the same format as for texture names. Throws an ArgumentException if the music does not exist. Note: SoundMP3 is in the Terraria.ModLoader namespace.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.MusicExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether or not a sound with the specified name exists.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.CleanupModReferences
member.summary: Several arrays and other fields hold references to various classes from mods, we need to clean them up to give properly coded mods a chance to be completely free of references so that they can be collected by the garbage collection. For most things eventually they will be replaced during gameplay, but we want the old instance completely gone quickly.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust
member.summary: This class represents a type of dust that is added by a mod. Only one instance of this class will ever exist for each type of dust you add.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.updateType
member.summary: Allows you to choose a type of dust for this type of dust to copy the behavior of. Defaults to -1, which means that no behavior is copied.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this type of dust.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Texture
member.summary: The sprite sheet that this type of dust uses. Normally a sprite sheet will consist of a vertical alignment of three 10 x 10 pixel squares, each one containing a possible look for the dust.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.mod
member.summary: The mod that added this type of dust.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Type
member.summary: The ID of this type of dust.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.GetDust(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the ModDust instance with the given type. Returns null if no ModDust with the given type exists.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Autoload(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a type of dust without having to use Mod.AddDust. By default returns the mod's Autoload property. Return true to automatically add the dust. Name will be initialized to the dust's class name, and Texture will be initialized to the dust's namespace and overriding class name with periods replaced with slashes. The name parameter determines the internal name and the texture parameter determines the texture path.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set this ModDust's updateType field and modify the Terraria.GameContent.ChildSafety.SafeDust array.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.OnSpawn(Terraria.Dust)
member.summary: Allows you to modify a dust's fields when it is created.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Update(Terraria.Dust)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how you want this type of dust to behave. Return true to allow for vanilla dust updating to also take place; will return true by default. Normally you will want this to return false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.MidUpdate(Terraria.Dust)
member.summary: Allows you to add behavior to this dust on top of the default dust behavior. Return true if you're applying your own behavior; return false to make the dust slow down by itself. Normally you will want this to return true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.GetAlpha(Terraria.Dust,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to override the color this dust will draw in. Return null to draw it in the normal light color; returns null by default. Note that the dust.noLight field makes the dust ignore lighting and draw in full brightness, and can be set in OnSpawn instead of having to return Color.White here.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore
member.summary: This class allows you to customize the behavior of a custom gore. Create a new instance of this and pass it as a parameter to Mod.AddGore to customize the gore you are adding. If you are autoloading gore, then give it the same name as the gore texture.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.updateType
member.summary: Allows you to copy the Update behavior of a different type of gore. This defaults to 0, which means no behavior is copied.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.GetGoreSlot(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the type of the custom gore corresponding to the given texture. Returns 0 if the texture does not represent a gore.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.OnSpawn(Terraria.Gore)
member.summary: Allows you to modify a gore's fields when it is created.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.Update(Terraria.Gore)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how you want this type of gore to behave. Return true to allow for vanilla gore updating to also take place; returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.GetAlpha(Terraria.Gore,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to override the color this gore will draw in. Return null to draw it in the normal light color; returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.DrawBehind(Terraria.Gore)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether or not this gore will draw behind tiles, etc. Returns false by default.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModHotKey
member.summary: Represents a loaded hotkey. It is suggested to access the hotkey status only in ModPlayer.ProcessTriggers.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModHotKey.GetAssignedKeys(Terraria.GameInput.InputMode)
member.summary: Gets the currently assigned keybindings. Useful for prompts, tooltips, informing users.
member.param: The InputMode. Choose between InputMode.Keyboard and InputMode.XBoxGamepad

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModHotKey.Current
member.summary: Returns true if this hotkey is pressed currently. Useful for createing a behavior that relies on the hotkey being held down.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModHotKey.JustPressed
member.summary: Returns true if this hotkey was just released this update. This is a fire-once-per-press behavior.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModHotKey.JustReleased
member.summary: Returns true if this hotkey was just released this update.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModHotKey.Old
member.summary: Returns true if this hotkey was pressed the previous update.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem
member.summary: This class serves as a place for you to place all your properties and hooks for each item. Create instances of ModItem (preferably overriding this class) to pass as parameters to Mod.AddItem.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.item
member.summary: The item object that this ModItem controls.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.mod
member.summary: Gets the mod.
member.value: The mod that added this ModItem.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this ModItem.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DisplayName
member.summary: The translations for the display name of this item.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Tooltip
member.summary: The translations for the display name of this tooltip.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Texture
member.summary: The file name of this item's texture file in the mod loader's file space.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically load an item instead of using Mod.AddItem. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Use this method to force or stop an autoload or change the internal name.
member.param: The name, initialized to the name of this type.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CloneNewInstances
member.summary: Whether instances of this ModItem are created through Clone or constructor (by default implementations of NewInstance and Clone(Item, Item)). Defaults to false (using default constructor).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Clone
member.summary: Returns a clone of this ModItem. Allows you to decide which fields of your ModItem class are copied over when an item stack is split or something similar happens. By default this will return a memberwise clone; you will want to override this if your ModItem contains object references. Only called if CloneNewInstances is set to true. Since several ModItem class fields are also set by the default implementation of this method, you'll most likely want to call base.Clone() as the first statement of your override.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Clone(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Create a copy of this instanced ModItem. Called when an item is cloned. Defaults to NewInstance(item)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.NewInstance(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Create a new instance of this ModItem for an Item instance. Called at the end of Item.SetDefaults. If CloneNewInstances is true, just calls Clone() Otherwise calls the default constructor and copies fields

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.SetDefaults
member.summary: This is where you set all your item's properties, such as width, damage, shootSpeed, defense, etc. For those that are familiar with tAPI, this has the same function as .json files.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AutoDefaults
member.summary: Automatically sets certain defaults. Override this if you do not want the properties to be set for you.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.SetStaticDefaults
member.summary: This is where you set all your item's static properties, such as names/translations and the arrays in ItemID.Sets. This is called after SetDefaults on the initial ModItem

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AutoStaticDefaults
member.summary: Automatically sets certain static defaults. Override this if you do not want the properties to be set for you.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ChoosePrefix(Terraria.Utilities.UnifiedRandom)
member.summary: Allows you to manually choose what prefix an item will get.
member.returns: The ID of the prefix to give the item, -1 to use default vanilla behavior

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PrefixChance(System.Int32,Terraria.Utilities.UnifiedRandom)
member.summary:
To prevent putting the item in the tinkerer slot, return false when pre is -3. To prevent rolling of a prefix on spawn, return false when pre is -1. To force rolling of a prefix on spawn, return true when pre is -1.
To reduce the probability of a prefix on spawn (pre == -1) to X%, return false 100-4X % of the time. To increase the probability of a prefix on spawn (pre == -1) to X%, return true (4X-100)/3 % of the time.
To delete a prefix from an item when the item is loaded, return false when pre is the prefix you want to delete. Use AllowPrefix to prevent rolling of a certain prefix.
member.param: The prefix being applied to the item, or the roll mode. -1 is when the item is naturally generated in a chest, crafted, purchased from an NPC, looted from a grab bag (excluding presents), or dropped by a slain enemy (if it's spawned with prefixGiven: -1). -2 is when the item is rolled in the tinkerer. -3 determines if the item can be placed in the tinkerer slot.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AllowPrefix(System.Int32)
member.summary: Force a re-roll of a prefix by returning false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanUseItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Returns whether or not this item can be used. By default returns true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseStyle(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the location and rotation of this item in its use animation.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HoldStyle(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the location and rotation of this item when the player is holding it.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HoldItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the player is holding this item (for example, torches make light and water candles increase spawn rate).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseTimeMultiplier(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to change the effective useTime of this item.
member.returns: The multiplier on the usage speed. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item speed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.MeleeSpeedMultiplier(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to change the effective useAnimation of this item.
member.returns: The multiplier on the animation speed. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item speed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetHealLife(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of life a life healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healLife value.
member.param: Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of life being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetHealMana(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana a mana healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healMana value.
member.param: Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of mana being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ModifyManaCost(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana this item will consume on use, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a mana value.
member.param: Used for decreasingly stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use -= on this field.
Use to directly multiply the item's effective mana cost. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg meteor armor set bonus).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnMissingMana(Terraria.Player,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player doesn't have enough mana for the item they are trying to use. If the player has high enough mana after this hook runs, mana consumption will happen normally. Only runs once per item use.
member.param: The mana needed to use the item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnConsumeMana(Terraria.Player,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player consumes mana on use of this item.
member.param: The mana consumed from the player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetWeaponDamage(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify this weapon's damage based on player buffs, etc. This is useful for creating new classes of damage, or for making subclasses of damage (for example, Shroomite armor set boosts). Note that tModLoader follows vanilla principle of only allowing one effective damage class at a time. This means that if you want your own custom damage class, all vanilla damage classes must be set to false. Vanilla checks classes in this order: melee, ranged, magic, thrown, summon So if you set both melee class and another class to true, only the melee damage will actually be used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ModifyWeaponDamage(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify this weapon's damage based on player buffs, etc. This is useful for creating new classes of damage, or for making subclasses of damage (for example, Shroomite armor set boosts).
member.param: Used for additively stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use += on this field.
Use to directly multiply the player's effective damage. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg ammo type buffs)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ModifyWeaponDamage(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify this weapon's damage based on player buffs, etc. This is useful for creating new classes of damage, or for making subclasses of damage (for example, Shroomite armor set boosts).
member.param: Used for additively stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use += on this field. Things with effects like "5% increased MyDamageClass damage" would use this: `add += 0.05`
Use to directly multiply the player's effective damage. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg ammo type buffs)
This is a flat damage bonus that will be added after add and mult are applied. It facilitates effects like "4 more damage from weapons"

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetWeaponKnockback(Terraria.Player,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify this weapon's knockback based on player buffs, etc. This allows you to customize knockback beyond the Player class's limited fields. Note that tModLoader follows vanilla principle of only allowing one effective damage class at a time. This means that if you want your own custom damage class, all vanilla damage classes must be set to false. Vanilla checks classes in this order: melee, ranged, magic, thrown, summon So if you set both melee class and another class to true, only the melee knockback will actually be used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetWeaponCrit(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify this weapon's crit chance based on player buffs, etc. Note that tModLoader follows vanilla principle of only allowing one effective damage class at a time. This means that if you want your own custom damage class, all vanilla damage classes must be set to false. If you use a custom damage class, the crit value will equal item.crit Vanilla checks classes in this order: melee, ranged, magic, thrown, and summon cannot crit. So if you set both melee class and another class to true, only the melee crit will actually be used.
member.param: The critical strike chance, at 0 it will never trigger a crit and at 100 or above it will always trigger a crit

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PickAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the projectile created by a weapon based on the ammo it is using. This hook is called on the ammo.
member.param: The item that is using this ammo
The ID of the projectile shot
The speed of the projectile shot
The damage of the projectile shot
The speed of the projectile shot

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Whether or not ammo will be consumed upon usage. Called both by the gun and by the ammo; if at least one returns false then the ammo will not be used. By default returns true. If false is returned, the OnConsumeAmmo hook is never called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to makes things happen when ammo is consumed. Called both by the gun and by the ammo. Called before the ammo stack is reduced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Shoot(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: This is called before the weapon creates a projectile. You can use it to create special effects, such as changing the speed, changing the initial position, and/or firing multiple projectiles. Return false to stop the game from shooting the default projectile (do this if you manually spawn your own projectile). Returns true by default.
member.param: The speed x calculated from shootSpeed and mouse position.
The speed y calculated from shootSpeed and mouse position.
The projectile type choosen by ammo and weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseItemHitbox(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Changes the hitbox of this melee weapon when it is used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.MeleeEffects(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Allows you to give this melee weapon special effects, such as creating light or dust.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanHitNPC(Terraria.Player,Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this melee weapon can hit the given NPC when swung. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block this weapon from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.Player,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this melee weapon does to an NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnHitNPC(Terraria.Player,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this melee weapon hits an NPC (for example how the Pumpkin Sword creates pumpkin heads).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanHitPvp(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this melee weapon can hit the given opponent player when swung. Return false to block this weapon from hitting the target. Returns true by default.
member.returns: true if this instance [can hit PVP] the specified player; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ModifyHitPvp(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that this melee weapon does to a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnHitPvp(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this melee weapon hits a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this item is used. Return true if using this item actually does stuff. Returns false by default. Runs on all clients and server. Use if (player.whoAmI == Main.myPlayer) and if (Main.netMode == NetmodeID.??) if appropriate.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ConsumeItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If this item is consumable and this returns true, then this item will be consumed upon usage. Returns true by default. If false is returned, the OnConsumeItem hook is never called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnConsumeItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this item is consumed. Called before the item stack is reduced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseItemFrame(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the player's animation when this item is being used. Return true if you modify the player's animation. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HoldItemFrame(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the player's animation when the player is holding this item. Return true if you modify the player's animation. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AltFunctionUse(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make this item usable by right-clicking. Returns false by default. When this item is used by right-clicking, player.altFunctionUse will be set to 2.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UpdateInventory(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this item is in the player's inventory (for example, how the cell phone makes information display).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UpdateEquip(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to give effects to this armor or accessory, such as increased damage.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UpdateAccessory(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to give effects to this accessory. The hideVisual parameter is whether the player has marked the accessory slot to be hidden from being drawn on the player.
member.param: if set to true the accessory is hidden.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UpdateVanity(Terraria.Player,Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects (such as dust) when this item's equipment texture of the given equipment type is displayed on the player. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.IsArmorSet(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the head armor, body armor, and leg armor make up a set. If this returns true, then this item's UpdateArmorSet method will be called. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UpdateArmorSet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to give set bonuses to the armor set that this armor is in. Set player.setBonus to a string for the bonus description.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.IsVanitySet(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the head armor, body armor, and leg armor textures make up a set. This hook is used for the PreUpdateVanitySet, UpdateVanitySet, and ArmorSetShadow hooks. By default, this will return the same value as the IsArmorSet hook (passing the equipment textures' associated items as parameters), so you will not have to use this hook unless you want vanity effects to be entirely separate from armor sets. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PreUpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects (such as the necro armor's hurt noise) when the player wears this item's vanity set. This hook is called regardless of whether the player is frozen in any way. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects (such as dust) when the player wears this item's vanity set. This hook will only be called if the player is not frozen in any way. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ArmorSetShadows(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine special visual effects this vanity set has on the player without having to code them yourself. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture. Use the player.armorEffectDraw bools to activate the desired effects.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.SetMatch(System.Boolean,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the equipment that the player appears to be wearing. This hook will only be called for body armor and leg armor. Note that equipSlot is not the same as the item type of the armor the player will appear to be wearing. Worn equipment has a separate set of IDs. You can find the vanilla equipment IDs by looking at the headSlot, bodySlot, and legSlot fields for items, and modded equipment IDs by looking at EquipLoader. If this hook is called on body armor, equipSlot allows you to modify the leg armor the player appears to be wearing. If you modify it, make sure to set robes to true. If this hook is called on leg armor, equipSlot allows you to modify the leg armor the player appears to be wearing, and the robes parameter is useless. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanRightClick
member.summary: Returns whether or not this item does something when it is right-clicked in the inventory. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.RightClick(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this item is right-clicked in the inventory. Useful for goodie bags.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OpenBossBag(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to give items to the given player when this item is right-clicked in the inventory if the bossBagNPC field has been set to a positive number. This ignores the CanRightClick and RightClick hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ReforgePrice(System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns if the normal reforge pricing is applied. If true or false is returned and the price is altered, the price will equal the altered price. The passed reforge price equals the item.value. Vanilla pricing will apply 20% discount if applicable and then price the reforge at a third of that value.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.NewPreReforge
member.summary: This hook gets called when the player clicks on the reforge button and can afford the reforge. Returns whether the reforge will take place. If false is returned, the PostReforge hook is never called. Reforging preserves modded data on the item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PostReforge
member.summary: This hook gets called immediately after an item gets reforged by the Goblin Tinkerer. Useful for modifying modded data based on the reforge result.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DrawHands(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether the skin/shirt on the player's arms and hands are drawn when this body armor is worn. By default both flags will be false. Note that if drawHands is false, the arms will not be drawn either. Also note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DrawHair(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether the player's hair or alt (hat) hair draws when this head armor is worn. By default both flags will be false. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.
member.param: if set to true [draw alt hair].

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DrawHead
member.summary: Return false to hide the player's head when this head armor is worn. Returns true by default. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DrawBody
member.summary: Return false to hide the player's body when this body armor is worn. Returns true by default. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DrawLegs
member.summary: Return false to hide the player's legs when this leg armor or shoe accessory is worn. Returns true by default. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DrawArmorColor(Terraria.Player,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@,System.Int32@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the colors in which this armor and surrounding accessories are drawn, in addition to which glow mask and in what color is drawn. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ArmorArmGlowMask(Terraria.Player,System.Single,System.Int32@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify which glow mask and in what color is drawn on the player's arms. Note that this is only called for body armor. Also note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.VerticalWingSpeeds(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the speeds at which you rise and fall when these wings are equipped.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HorizontalWingSpeeds(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify these wing's horizontal flight speed and acceleration.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.WingUpdate(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows for Wings to do various things while in use. "inUse" is whether or not the jump button is currently pressed. Called when these wings visually appear on the player. Use to animate wings, create dusts, invoke sounds, and create lights. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture. False will keep everything the same. True, you need to handle all animations in your own code.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Update(System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize this item's movement when lying in the world. Note that this will not be called if this item is currently being grabbed by a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanBurnInLava
member.summary: Returns whether or not this item burns when it is thrown into lava despite item.rare not being 0. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PostUpdate
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this item is lying in the world. This will always be called, even when it is being grabbed by a player. This hook should be used for adding light, or for increasing the age of less valuable items.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GrabRange(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify how close this item must be to the player in order to move towards the player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GrabStyle(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the way this item moves towards the player. Return true if you override this hook; returning false will allow the vanilla grab style to take place. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanPickup(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether or not the item can be picked up

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnPickup(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make special things happen when the player picks up this item. Return false to stop the item from being added to the player's inventory; returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ItemSpace(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Return true to specify that the item can be picked up despite not having enough room in inventory. Useful for something like hearts or experience items. Use in conjunction with OnPickup to actually consume the item and handle it.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetAlpha(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the color and transparency in which this item is drawn. Return null to use the default color (normally light color). Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PreDrawInWorld(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind this item, or to modify the way this item is drawn in the world. Return false to stop the game from drawing the item (useful if you're manually drawing the item). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PostDrawInWorld(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of this item. This method is called even if PreDrawInWorld returns false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PreDrawInInventory(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind this item in the inventory. Return false to stop the game from drawing the item (useful if you're manually drawing the item). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PostDrawInInventory(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of this item in the inventory. This method is called even if PreDrawInInventory returns false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HoldoutOffset
member.summary: Allows you to determine the offset of this item's sprite when used by the player. This is only used for items with a useStyle of 5 that aren't staves. Return null to use the vanilla holdout offset; returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HoldoutOrigin
member.summary: Allows you to determine the point on this item's sprite that the player holds onto when using this item. The origin is from the bottom left corner of the sprite. This is only used for staves with a useStyle of 5. Return null to use the vanilla holdout origin (zero); returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanEquipAccessory(Terraria.Player,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to disallow the player from equipping this accessory. Return false to disallow equipping this accessory. Returns true by default.
member.param: The inventory slot that the item is attempting to occupy.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ExtractinatorUse(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify what item, and in what quantity, is obtained when this item is fed into the Extractinator. By default the parameters will be set to the output of feeding Silt/Slush into the Extractinator.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AutoLightSelect(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to tell the game whether this item is a torch that cannot be placed in liquid, a torch that can be placed in liquid, or a glowstick. This information is used for when the player is holding down the auto-select hotkey.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CaughtFishStack(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how many of this item a player obtains when the player fishes this item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.IsQuestFish
member.summary: Whether or not the Angler can ever randomly request this type of item for his daily quest. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.IsAnglerQuestAvailable
member.summary: Whether or not specific conditions have been satisfied for the Angler to be able to request this item. (For example, Hardmode.) Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AnglerQuestChat(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to set what the Angler says when he requests for this item. The description parameter is his dialogue, and catchLocation should be set to "\n(Caught at [location])".

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnlyShootOnSwing
member.summary: Setting this to true makes it so that this weapon can shoot projectiles only at the beginning of its animation. Set this to true if you want a sword and its projectile creation to be in sync (for example, the Terra Blade). Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.BossBagNPC
member.summary: The type of NPC that drops this boss bag. Used to determine how many coins this boss bag contains. Defaults to 0, which means this isn't a boss bag.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.IgnoreDamageModifiers
member.summary: Set this to true to prevent this weapon or ammo item from being adjusted by damage modifiers.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Save
member.summary: Allows you to save custom data for this item. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Load(Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary: Allows you to load custom data that you have saved for this item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.LoadLegacy(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Allows you to load pre-v0.9 custom data that you have saved for this item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.NetSend(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Allows you to send custom data for this item between client and server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.NetRecieve(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Receives the custom data sent in the NetSend hook.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AddRecipes
member.summary: This is essentially the same as Mod.AddRecipes. Do note that this will be called for every instance of the overriding ModItem class that is added to the game. This allows you to avoid clutter in your overriding Mod class by adding recipes for which this item is the result.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnCraft(Terraria.Recipe)
member.summary: Allows you to make anything happen when the player crafts this item using the given recipe.
member.param: The recipe that was used to craft this item.

member.summary: Allows you to do things before this item's tooltip is drawn.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModLoader
member.summary: This serves as the central class which loads mods. It contains many static fields and methods related to mods and their contents.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModLoader.GetMod(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the instance of the Mod with the specified name.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModLoader._enabledMods
member.summary: A cached list of enabled mods (not necessarily currently loaded or even installed), mirroring the enabled.json file.

member.summary: Allows type inference on T and F

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData
member.summary: This class serves as a place for you to place all your properties and hooks for each mount. Create instances of ModMoundData (preferably overriding this class) to pass as parameters to Mod.AddMount. Only one instance of ModMountData will exist for each mount, so storing player specific data on the ModMountData is not good. Modders can use player.mount._mountSpecificData or a ModPlayer class to store player specific data relating to a mount. Use SetMount to assign these fields.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.mountData
member.summary: The vanilla MountData object that is controlled by this ModMountData.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.mod
member.summary: The mod which has added this ModMountData.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.Type
member.summary: The index of this ModMountData in the Mount.mounts array.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.Name
member.summary: The name of this type of mount.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.Autoload(System.String@,System.String@,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{Terraria.ModLoader.MountTextureType,System.String})
member.summary: Allows you to automatically load a mount instead of using Mod.AddMount. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name, texture is initialized to the namespace and overriding class name with periods replaced with slashes, and extraTextures is initialized to a dictionary containing all MountTextureTypes as keys, with texture + "_" + the texture type name as values. Use this method to either force or stop an autoload, change the default display name and texture path, and to modify the extra mount textures.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set the properties of this type of mount.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.JumpHeight(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the mount's jump height based on its state.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.JumpSpeed(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the mount's jump speed based on its state.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.UpdateEffects(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when mount is used (creating dust etc.) Can also be used for mount special abilities.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.UpdateFrame(Terraria.Player,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Allows for manual updating of mount frame. Return false to stop the default frame behavior. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.UseAbility(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen while the mouse is pressed while the mount is active. Called each tick the mouse is pressed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.AimAbility(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the mount ability is aiming (while charging).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.SetMount(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this mount is spawned in. Useful for player-specific initialization, utilizing player.mount._mountSpecificData or a ModPlayer class since ModMountData is shared between all players. Custom dust spawning logic is also possible via the skipDust parameter.
member.param: Set to true to skip the vanilla dust spawning logic

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMountData.Dismount(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this mount is de-spawned. Useful for player-specific cleanup, see SetMount. Custom dust spawning logic is also possible via the skipDust parameter.
member.param: Set to true to skip the vanilla dust spawning logic

member.summary: Allows for complete customization of mount drawing. This method will be called once for each supported mount texture layer that exists.
