Use drawType to conditionally apply changes. drawType corresponds to the following: 0: backTexture, 1: backTextureExtra, 2: frontTexture. 3: frontTextureExtra Corresponding glow textures, such as backTextureGlow, are paired with their corresponding texture and passed into this method as well. Return false if you are manually adding DrawData to playerDrawData to replace the vanilla draw behavior, otherwise tweak ref variables to customize the drawing and add additional DrawData to playerDrawData.
member.param: Corresponds to the following: 0: backTexture, 1: backTextureExtra, 2: frontTexture. 3: frontTextureExtra
The corresponding glow texture, if present

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC
member.summary: This class serves as a place for you to place all your properties and hooks for each NPC. Create instances of ModNPC (preferably overriding this class) to pass as parameters to Mod.AddNPC.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.npc
member.summary: The NPC object that this ModNPC controls.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.mod
member.summary: The mod that added this ModNPC.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this NPC.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DisplayName
member.summary: The translations for the display name of this NPC.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.Texture
member.summary: The file name of this NPC's texture file in the mod loader's file space.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.HeadTexture
member.summary: The file name of this NPC's head texture file, to be used in autoloading.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadTexture
member.summary: This file name of this NPC's boss head texture file, to be used in autoloading.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.aiType
member.summary: Determines which type of vanilla NPC this ModNPC will copy the behavior (AI) of. Leave as 0 to not copy any behavior. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.animationType
member.summary: Determines which type of vanilla NPC this ModNPC will copy the animation (FindFrame) of. Leave as 0 to not copy any animation. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.bossBag
member.summary: The item type of the boss bag that is dropped when DropBossBags is called for this NPC.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.music
member.summary: The ID of the music that plays when this NPC is on or near the screen. Defaults to -1, which means music plays normally.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.musicPriority
member.summary: The priority of the music that plays when this NPC is on or near the screen.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.drawOffsetY
member.summary: The vertical offset used for drawing this NPC. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.banner
member.summary: The type of NPC that this NPC will be considered as when determining banner drops and banner bonuses. By default this will be 0, which means this NPC is not associated with any banner. To give your NPC its own banner, set this field to the NPC's type.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.bannerItem
member.summary: The type of the item this NPC drops for every 50 times it is defeated. For any ModNPC whose banner field is set to the type of this NPC, that ModNPC will drop this banner.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.#ctor
member.summary: ModNPC constructor.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically load an NPC instead of using Mod.AddNPC. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name, texture is initialized to the namespace and overriding class name with periods replaced with slashes, and altTextures is initialized to null. Use this method to either force or stop an autoload, or to change the default display name.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CloneNewInstances
member.summary: Whether instances of this ModNPC are created through a memberwise clone or its constructor. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.Clone
member.summary: Returns a clone of this ModNPC. Allows you to decide which fields of your ModNPC class are copied over when a new NPC is created. By default this will return a memberwise clone; you will want to override this if your ModNPC contains object references. Only called if CloneNewInstances is set to true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.NewInstance(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Create a new instance of this ModNPC for an NPC instance. Called at the end of NPC.SetDefaults. If CloneNewInstances is true, just calls Clone() Otherwise calls the default constructor and copies fields

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set all your NPC's properties, such as width, damage, aiStyle, lifeMax, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetStaticDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set all your NPC's static properties, such as names/translations and the arrays in NPCID.Sets.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.AutoStaticDefaults
member.summary: Automatically sets certain static defaults. Override this if you do not want the properties to be set for you.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ScaleExpertStats(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to customize this NPC's stats in expert mode. This is useful because expert mode's doubling of damage and life might be too much sometimes (for example, with bosses). Also useful for scaling life with the number of players in the world.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ResetEffects
member.summary: This is where you reset any fields you add to your subclass to their default states. This is necessary in order to reset your fields if they are conditionally set by a tick update but the condition is no longer satisfied. (Note: This hook is only really useful for GlobalNPC, but is included in ModNPC for completion.)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PreAI
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this NPC behaves. Return false to stop the vanilla AI and the AI hook from being run. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.AI
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this NPC behaves. This will only be called if PreAI returns true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SendExtraAI(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: If you are storing AI information outside of the npc.ai array, use this to send that AI information between clients and servers.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ReceiveExtraAI(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Use this to receive information that was sent in SendExtraAI.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.FindFrame(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the frame from this NPC's texture that is drawn, which is necessary in order to animate NPCs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.UpdateLifeRegen(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to make the NPC either regenerate health or take damage over time by setting npc.lifeRegen. Regeneration or damage will occur at a rate of half of npc.lifeRegen per second. The damage parameter is the number that appears above the NPC's head if it takes damage over time.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CheckActive
member.summary: Whether or not to run the code for checking whether this NPC will remain active. Return false to stop this NPC from being despawned and to stop this NPC from counting towards the limit for how many NPCs can exist near a player. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CheckDead
member.summary: Whether or not this NPC should be killed when it reaches 0 health. You may program extra effects in this hook (for example, how Golem's head lifts up for the second phase of its fight). Return false to stop this NPC from being killed. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SpecialNPCLoot
member.summary: Allows you to call NPCLoot on your own when the NPC dies, rather then letting vanilla call it on its own. Useful for things like dropping loot from the nearest segment of a worm boss. Returns false by default.
member.returns: Return true to stop vanilla from calling NPCLoot on its own. Do this if you call NPCLoot yourself.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PreNPCLoot
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether or not this NPC will drop anything at all. Return false to stop the NPC from dropping anything. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.NPCLoot
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this NPC dies (for example, dropping items and setting ModWorld fields). This hook runs on the server/single player. For client-side effects, such as dust, gore, and sounds, see HitEffect

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnCatchNPC(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this NPC is caught. Ran Serverside
member.param: The item that will be spawned

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossLoot(System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize what happens when this boss dies, such as which name is displayed in the defeat message and what type of potion it drops.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can hit the given player. Return false to block this NPC from hitting the target. Returns true by default. CooldownSlot determines which of the player's cooldown counters to use (-1, 0, or 1), and defaults to -1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that this NPC does to a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC hits a player (for example, inflicting debuffs).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanHitNPC(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can hit the given friendly NPC. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block this NPC from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this NPC does to a friendly NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC hits a friendly NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanBeHitByItem(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can be hit by the given melee weapon when swung. Return true to allow hitting the NPC, return false to block hitting the NPC, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitByItem(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this NPC takes from a melee weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitByItem(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC is hit by a melee weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanBeHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can be hit by the given projectile. Return true to allow hitting the NPC, return false to block hitting the NPC, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this NPC takes from a projectile. This method is only called for the owner of the projectile, meaning that in multi-player, projectiles owned by a player call this method on that client, and projectiles owned by the server such as enemy projectiles call this method on the server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC is hit by a projectile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.StrikeNPC(System.Double@,System.Int32,System.Single@,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to use a custom damage formula for when this NPC takes damage from any source. For example, you can change the way defense works or use a different crit multiplier. Return false to stop the game from running the vanilla damage formula; returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadSlot(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize the boss head texture used by this NPC based on its state.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadRotation(System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize the rotation of this NPC's boss head icon on the map.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadSpriteEffects(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteEffects@)
member.summary: Allows you to flip this NPC's boss head icon on the map.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.GetAlpha(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the color and transparency in which this NPC is drawn. Return null to use the default color (normally light and buff color). Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawEffects(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Allows you to add special visual effects to this NPC (such as creating dust), and modify the color in which the NPC is drawn.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PreDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind this NPC, or to modify the way this NPC is drawn. Return false to stop the game from drawing the NPC (useful if you're manually drawing the NPC). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PostDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of this NPC. This method is called even if PreDraw returns false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawBehind(System.Int32)
member.summary: When used in conjunction with "npc.hide = true", allows you to specify that this npc should be drawn behind certain elements. Add the index to one of Main.DrawCacheNPCsMoonMoon, DrawCacheNPCsOverPlayers, DrawCacheNPCProjectiles, or DrawCacheNPCsBehindNonSolidTiles.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawHealthBar(System.Byte,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Allows you to control how the health bar for this NPC is drawn. The hbPosition parameter is the same as Main.hbPosition; it determines whether the health bar gets drawn above or below the NPC by default. The scale parameter is the health bar's size. By default, it will be the normal 1f; most bosses set this to 1.5f. Return null to let the normal vanilla health-bar-drawing code to run. Return false to stop the health bar from being drawn. Return true to draw the health bar in the position specified by the position parameter (note that this is the world position, not screen position).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SpawnChance(Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo)
member.summary: Whether or not this NPC can spawn with the given spawning conditions. Return the weight for the chance of this NPC to spawn compared to vanilla mobs. All vanilla mobs combined have a total weight of 1. Returns 0 by default, which disables natural spawning. Remember to always use spawnInfo.player and not Main.LocalPlayer when checking Player or ModPlayer fields, otherwise your mod won't work in Multiplayer.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SpawnNPC(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how this NPC is created when it naturally spawns (for example, its position or ai array). Return the return value of NPC.NewNPC. By default this method spawns this NPC on top of the tile at the given coordinates.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanTownNPCSpawn(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Whether or not the conditions have been met for this town NPC to be able to move into town. For example, the Demolitionist requires that any player has an explosive.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CheckConditions(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to define special conditions required for this town NPC's house. For example, Truffle requires the house to be in an aboveground mushroom biome.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCName
member.summary: Allows you to give this town NPC any name when it spawns. By default returns something embarrassing.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.UsesPartyHat
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this town NPC wears a party hat during a party. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanChat
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can talk with the player. By default, returns if the NPC is a town NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.GetChat
member.summary: Allows you to give this NPC a chat message when a player talks to it. By default returns something embarrassing.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetChatButtons(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to set the text for the buttons that appear on this NPC's chat window. A parameter left as an empty string will not be included as a button on the chat window.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnChatButtonClicked(System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make something happen whenever a button is clicked on this NPC's chat window. The firstButton parameter tells whether the first button or second button (button and button2 from SetChatButtons) was clicked. Set the shop parameter to true to open this NPC's shop.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetupShop(Terraria.Chest,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to add items to this NPC's shop. Add an item by setting the defaults of shop.item[nextSlot] then incrementing nextSlot. In the end, nextSlot must have a value of 1 greater than the highest index in shop.item that contains an item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanGoToStatue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether this NPC can be telported to a King or Queen statue. Returns false by default.
member.param: Whether the NPC is being teleported to a King or Queen statue.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnGoToStatue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this NPC teleports to a King or Queen statue. This method is only called server side.
member.param: Whether the NPC was teleported to a King or Queen statue.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackStrength(System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the damage and knockback of this town NPC's attack before the damage is scaled. (More information on scaling in GlobalNPC.BuffTownNPCs.)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackCooldown(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the cooldown between each of this town NPC's attack. The cooldown will be a number greater than or equal to the first parameter, and less then the sum of the two parameters.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackProj(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the projectile type of this town NPC's attack, and how long it takes for the projectile to actually appear. This hook is only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 0 (throwing), 1 (shooting), or 2 (magic).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackProjSpeed(System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the speed at which this town NPC throws a projectile when it attacks. Multiplier is the speed of the projectile, gravityCorrection is how much extra the projectile gets thrown upwards, and randomOffset allows you to randomize the projectile's velocity in a square centered around the original velocity. This hook is only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 0 (throwing), 1 (shooting), or 2 (magic).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackShoot(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to tell the game that this town NPC has already created a projectile and will still create more projectiles as part of a single attack so that the game can animate the NPC's attack properly. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 1 (shooting).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackMagic(System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to control the brightness of the light emitted by this town NPC's aura when it performs a magic attack. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 2 (magic)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackSwing(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the width and height of the item this town NPC swings when it attacks, which controls the range of this NPC's swung weapon. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 3 (swinging).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawTownAttackGun(System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how this town NPC's weapon is drawn when this NPC is shooting (this NPC must have an attack type of 1). Scale is a multiplier for the item's drawing size, item is the ID of the item to be drawn, and closeness is how close the item should be drawn to the NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawTownAttackSwing(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D@,System.Int32@,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how this town NPC's weapon is drawn when this NPC is swinging it (this NPC must have an attack type of 3). Item is the Texture2D instance of the item to be drawn (use Main.itemTexture[id of item]), itemSize is the width and height of the item's hitbox (the same values for TownNPCAttackSwing), scale is the multiplier for the item's drawing size, and offset is the offset from which to draw the item from its normal position.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPacket
member.summary:
This class inherits from BinaryWriter. This means that you can use all of its writing functions to send information between client and server. This class also comes with a Send method that's used to actually send everything you've written between client and server.
ModPacket has all the same methods as BinaryWriter, and some additional ones.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPacket.Send(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends all the information you've written between client and server. If the toClient parameter is non-negative, this packet will only be sent to the specified client. If the ignoreClient parameter is non-negative, this packet will not be sent to the specified client.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer
member.summary: A ModPlayer instance represents an extension of a Player instance. You can store fields in the ModPlayer classes, much like how the Player class abuses field usage, to keep track of mod-specific information on the player that a ModPlayer instance represents. It also contains hooks to insert your code into the Player class.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.mod
member.summary: The mod that added this type of ModPlayer.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Name
member.summary: The name of this ModPlayer. Used for distinguishing between multiple ModPlayers added by a single Mod, in addition to the argument passed to Player.GetModPlayer.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.player
member.summary: The Player instance that this ModPlayer instance is attached to.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CloneNewInstances
member.summary: Whether each player gets a ModPlayer by cloning the ModPlayer added to the Mod or by creating a new ModPlayer object with the same type as the ModPlayer added to the Mod. The accessor returns true by default. Return false if you want to assign fields through the constructor.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a ModPlayer instead of using Mod.AddPlayer. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this to either force or stop an autoload, or change the name that identifies this type of ModPlayer.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Initialize
member.summary: Called whenever the player is loaded (on the player selection screen). This can be used to initialize data structures, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ResetEffects
member.summary: This is where you reset any fields you add to your ModPlayer subclass to their default states. This is necessary in order to reset your fields if they are conditionally set by a tick update but the condition is no longer satisfied.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateDead
member.summary: Similar to UpdateDead, except this is only called when the player is dead. If this is called, then ResetEffects will not be called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreSaveCustomData
member.summary: Currently never gets called, so this is useless.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Save
member.summary: Allows you to save custom data for this player. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Load(Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary: Allows you to load custom data you have saved for this player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.LoadLegacy(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Allows you to load pre-v0.9 custom data you have saved for this player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.SetupStartInventory(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Terraria.Item},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the inventory newly created players or killed mediumcore players will start with. To add items to the player's inventory, create a new Item, call its SetDefaults method for whatever ID you want, call its Prefix method with a parameter of -1 if you want to give it a random prefix, then add it to the items list parameter.
member.param: If true, the inventory is being setup for a character that dies in mediumcore rather than a newly created player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreSavePlayer
member.summary: PreSavePlayer and PostSavePlayer wrap the vanilla player saving code (both are before the ModPlayer.Save). Useful for advanced situations where a save might be corrupted or rendered unusable by the values that normally would save.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostSavePlayer
member.summary: PreSavePlayer and PostSavePlayer wrap the vanilla player saving code (both are before the ModPlayer.Save). Useful for advanced situations where a save might be corrupted or rendered unusable by the values that normally would save.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateBiomes
member.summary: Allows you to set biome variables in your ModPlayer class based on tile counts.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CustomBiomesMatch(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Whether or not this player and the other player parameter have the same custom biome variables. This hook is used to help with client/server syncing. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CopyCustomBiomesTo(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: In this hook, you should copy the custom biome variables from this player to the other player parameter. This hook is used to help with client/server syncing.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.SendCustomBiomes(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Allows you to send custom biome information between client and server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ReceiveCustomBiomes(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Allows you to do things with the custom biome information you send between client and server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateBiomeVisuals
member.summary: Allows you to create special visual effects in the area around the player. For example, the blood moon's red filter on the screen or the slime rain's falling slime in the background. You must create classes that override Terraria.Graphics.Shaders.ScreenShaderData or Terraria.Graphics.Effects.CustomSky, add them in your mod's Load hook, then call Player.ManageSpecialBiomeVisuals. See the ExampleMod if you do not have access to the source code.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.clientClone(Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer)
member.summary: Allows you to copy information about this player to the clientClone parameter. You should copy information that you intend to sync between server and client. This hook is called in the Player.clientClone method. See SendClientChanges for more info.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.SyncPlayer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to sync information about this player between server and client. The toWho and fromWho parameters correspond to the remoteClient/toClient and ignoreClient arguments, respectively, of NetMessage.SendData/ModPacket.Send. The newPlayer parameter is whether or not the player is joining the server (it is true on the joining client).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.SendClientChanges(Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer)
member.summary: Allows you to sync any information that has changed between the server and client. Here, you should check the information you have copied in the clientClone parameter; if they differ between this player and the clientPlayer parameter, then you should send that information using NetMessage.SendData or ModPacket.Send.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetMapBackgroundImage
member.summary: Allows you to change the background that displays when viewing the map. Return null if you do not want to change the background. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateBadLifeRegen
member.summary: Allows you to give the player a negative life regeneration based on its state (for example, the "On Fire!" debuff makes the player take damage-over-time). This is typically done by setting player.lifeRegen to 0 if it is positive, setting player.lifeRegenTime to 0, and subtracting a number from player.lifeRegen. The player will take damage at a rate of half the number you subtract per second.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateLifeRegen
member.summary: Allows you to increase the player's life regeneration based on its state. This can be done by incrementing player.lifeRegen by a certain number. The player will recover life at a rate of half the number you add per second. You can also increment player.lifeRegenTime to increase the speed at which the player reaches its maximum natural life regeneration.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.NaturalLifeRegen(System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the power of the player's natural life regeneration. This can be done by multiplying the regen parameter by any number. For example, campfires multiply it by 1.1, while walking multiplies it by 0.5.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateAutopause
member.summary: Allows you to modify the player's stats while the game is paused due to the autopause setting being on. This is called in single player only, some time before the player's tick update would happen when the game isn't paused.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreUpdate
member.summary: This is called at the beginning of every tick update for this player, after checking whether the player exists.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ProcessTriggers(Terraria.GameInput.TriggersSet)
member.summary: Use this to check on hotkeys you have registered. While SetControls is set even while in text entry mode, this hook is only called during gameplay.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.SetControls
member.summary: Use this to modify the control inputs that the player receives. For example, the Confused debuff swaps the values of player.controlLeft and player.controlRight. This is called sometime after PreUpdate is called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreUpdateBuffs
member.summary: This is called sometime after SetControls is called, and right before all the buffs update on this player. This hook can be used to add buffs to the player based on the player's state (for example, the Campfire buff is added if the player is near a Campfire).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostUpdateBuffs
member.summary: This is called right after all of this player's buffs update on the player. This can be used to modify the effects that the buff updates had on this player, and can also be used for general update tasks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateEquips(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Called after Update Accessories.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostUpdateEquips
member.summary: This is called right after all of this player's equipment and armor sets update on the player, which is sometime after PostUpdateBuffs is called. This can be used to modify the effects that the equipment had on this player, and can also be used for general update tasks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostUpdateMiscEffects
member.summary: This is called after miscellaneous update code is called in Player.Update, which is sometime after PostUpdateEquips is called. This can be used for general update tasks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostUpdateRunSpeeds
member.summary: This is called after the player's horizontal speeds are modified, which is sometime after PostUpdateMiscEffects is called, and right before the player's horizontal position is updated. Use this to modify maxRunSpeed, accRunSpeed, runAcceleration, and similar variables before the player moves forwards/backwards.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreUpdateMovement
member.summary: This is called right before modifying the player's position based on velocity. Use this to make direct changes to the velocity.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostUpdate
member.summary: This is called at the very end of the Player.Update method. Final general update tasks can be placed here.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UpdateVanityAccessories
member.summary: This is called after VanillaUpdateVanityAccessory() in player.UpdateEquips()

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.FrameEffects
member.summary: Allows you to modify the armor and accessories that visually appear on the player. In addition, you can create special effects around this character, such as creating dust.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreHurt(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,Terraria.DataStructures.PlayerDeathReason@)
member.summary: This hook is called before every time the player takes damage. The pvp parameter is whether the damage was from another player. The quiet parameter determines whether the damage will be communicated to the server. The damage, hitDirection, and crit parameters can be modified. Set the customDamage parameter to true if you want to use your own damage formula (this parameter will disable automatically subtracting the player's defense from the damage). Set the playSound parameter to false to disable the player's hurt sound, and the genGore parameter to false to disable the dust particles that spawn. (These are useful for creating your own sound or gore.) The deathText parameter can be modified to change the player's death message if the player dies. Return false to stop the player from taking damage. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Hurt(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make anything happen right before damage is subtracted from the player's health.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostHurt(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make anything happen when the player takes damage.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreKill(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,Terraria.DataStructures.PlayerDeathReason@)
member.summary: This hook is called whenever the player is about to be killed after reaching 0 health. Set the playSound parameter to false to stop the death sound from playing. Set the genGore parameter to false to stop the gore and dust from being created. (These are useful for creating your own sound or gore.) Return false to stop the player from being killed. Only return false if you know what you are doing! Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Kill(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Terraria.DataStructures.PlayerDeathReason)
member.summary: Allows you to make anything happen when the player dies.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PreItemCheck
member.summary: Allows you to do anything before the update code for the player's held item is run. Return false to stop the held item update code from being run (for example, if the player is frozen). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostItemCheck
member.summary: Allows you to do anything after the update code for the player's held item is run. Hooks for the middle of the held item update code have more specific names in ModItem and ModPlayer.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.UseTimeMultiplier(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to multiply an item's regular use time. Returns 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item speed.
member.returns: The amount you wish to multiply with.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.MeleeSpeedMultiplier(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to multiply an item's regular melee speed. Returns 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item speed.
member.returns: The amount you wish to multiply with.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetHealLife(Terraria.Item,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of life a life healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healLife value.
member.param: Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of life being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetHealMana(Terraria.Item,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana a mana healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healMana value.
member.param: Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of mana being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyManaCost(Terraria.Item,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana an item will consume on use, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a mana value.
member.param: Used for decreasingly stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use -= on this field.
Use to directly multiply the item's effective mana cost. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg meteor armor set bonus).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnMissingMana(Terraria.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player doesn't have enough mana for the item they are trying to use. If the player has high enough mana after this hook runs, mana consumption will happen normally. Only runs once per item use.
member.param: The mana needed to use the item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnConsumeMana(Terraria.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player consumes mana on use of an item.
member.param: The mana consumed from the player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetWeaponDamage(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify a weapon's damage based on player buffs, etc. This is useful for creating new classes of damage, or for making subclasses of damage (for example, Shroomite armor set boosts).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyWeaponDamage(Terraria.Item,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify this weapon's damage based on player buffs, etc. This is useful for creating new classes of damage, or for making subclasses of damage (for example, Shroomite armor set boosts).
member.param: Used for additively stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use += on this field.
Use to directly multiply the player's effective damage. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg ammo type buffs)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyWeaponDamage(Terraria.Item,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify this weapon's damage based on player buffs, etc. This is useful for creating new classes of damage, or for making subclasses of damage (for example, Shroomite armor set boosts).
member.param: Used for additively stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use += on this field. Things with effects like "5% increased MyDamageClass damage" would use this: `add += 0.05`
Use to directly multiply the player's effective damage. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg ammo type buffs)
This is a flat damage bonus that will be added after add and mult are applied. It facilitates effects like "4 more damage from weapons"

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetWeaponKnockback(Terraria.Item,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify a weapon's knockback based on player buffs, etc. This allows you to customize knockback beyond the Player class's limited fields.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetWeaponCrit(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify a weapon's crit chance based on player buffs, etc.
member.param: The crit chance, ranging from 0 to 100

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Whether or not ammo will be consumed upon usage. Return false to stop the ammo from being depleted. Returns true by default. If false is returned, the OnConsumeAmmo hook is never called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when ammo is consumed. Called before the ammo stack is reduced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.Shoot(Terraria.Item,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: This is called before this player's weapon creates a projectile. You can use it to create special effects, such as changing the speed, changing the initial position, and/or firing multiple projectiles. Return false to stop the game from shooting the default projectile (do this if you manually spawn your own projectile). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.MeleeEffects(Terraria.Item,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Allows you to give this player's melee weapon special effects, such as creating light or dust.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnHitAnything(System.Single,System.Single,Terraria.Entity)
member.summary: This hook is called when a player damages anything, whether it be an NPC or another player, using anything, whether it be a melee weapon or a projectile. The x and y parameters are the coordinates of the victim parameter's center.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanHitNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a player can hit the given NPC by swinging a melee weapon. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block this player from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this player does to an NPC by swinging a melee weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnHitNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this player hits an NPC by swinging a melee weapon (for example how the Pumpkin Sword creates pumpkin heads).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanHitNPCWithProj(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a projectile created by this player can hit the given NPC. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block this projectile from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyHitNPCWithProj(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that a projectile created by this player does to an NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnHitNPCWithProj(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when a projectile created by this player hits an NPC (for example, inflicting debuffs).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanHitPvp(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a melee weapon swung by this player can hit the given opponent player. Return false to block this weapon from hitting the target. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyHitPvp(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that a melee weapon swung by this player does to an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnHitPvp(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this player's melee weapon hits an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanHitPvpWithProj(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a projectile created by this player can hit the given opponent player. Return false to block the projectile from hitting the target. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyHitPvpWithProj(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that a projectile created by this player does to an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnHitPvpWithProj(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when a projectile created by this player hits an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanBeHitByNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether the given NPC can hit this player. Return false to block this player from being hit by the NPC. Returns true by default. CooldownSlot determines which of the player's cooldown counters to use (-1, 0, or 1), and defaults to -1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyHitByNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that an NPC does to this player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnHitByNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when an NPC hits this player (for example, inflicting debuffs).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanBeHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether the given hostile projectile can hit this player. Return false to block this player from being hit. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that a hostile projectile does to this player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when a hostile projectile hits this player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CatchFish(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change the item the player gains from catching a fish. The fishingRod and bait parameters refer to the said items in the player's inventory. The liquidType parameter is 0 if the player is fishing in water, 1 for lava, and 2 for honey. The poolSize parameter is the tile size of the pool the player is fishing in. The worldLayer parameter is 0 if the player is in the sky, 1 if the player is on the surface, 2 if the player is underground, 3 if the player is in the caverns, and 4 if the player is in the underworld. The questFish parameter is the item ID for the day's Angler quest. Modify the caughtType parameter to change the item the player catches. The junk parameter is whether the player catches junk; you can set this to true if you make the player catch a junk item, and is mostly used to pass information (has no effect on the game).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetFishingLevel(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the player's fishing power. As an example of the type of stuff that should go here, the phase of the moon can influence fishing power.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.AnglerQuestReward(System.Single,System.Collections.Generic.List{Terraria.Item})
member.summary: Allows you to add to, change, or remove from the items the player earns when finishing an Angler quest. The rareMultiplier is a number between 0.15 and 1 inclusively; the lower it is the higher chance there should be for the player to earn rare items.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.GetDyeTraderReward(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Allows you to modify what items are possible for the player to earn when giving a Strange Plant to the Dye Trader.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.DrawEffects(Terraria.ModLoader.PlayerDrawInfo,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this player is drawn, such as creating dust, modifying the color the player is drawn in, etc. The fullBright parameter makes it so that the drawn player ignores the modified color and lighting. Note that the fullBright parameter only works if r, g, b, and/or a is not equal to 1. Make sure to add the indexes of any dusts you create to Main.playerDrawDust, and the indexes of any gore you create to Main.playerDrawGore.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyDrawInfo(Terraria.ModLoader.PlayerDrawInfo@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the drawing parameters of the player before drawing begins.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyDrawLayers(System.Collections.Generic.List{Terraria.ModLoader.PlayerLayer})
member.summary: Allows you to modify the drawing of the player. This is done by removing from, adding to, or rearranging the list, by setting some of the layers' visible field to false, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyDrawHeadLayers(System.Collections.Generic.List{Terraria.ModLoader.PlayerHeadLayer})
member.summary: Allows you to modify the drawing of the player head on the minimap. This is done by removing from, adding to, or rearranging the list, by setting some of the layers' visible field to false, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyScreenPosition
member.summary: Use this hook to modify Main.screenPosition after weapon zoom and camera lerp have taken place.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyZoom(System.Single@)
member.summary: Use this to modify the zoom factor for the player. The zoom correlates to the percentage of half the screen size the zoom can reach. A value of -1 passed in means no vanilla scope is in effect. A value of 1.0 means the scope can zoom half a screen width/height away, putting the player on the edge of the game screen. Vanilla values include .8, .6666, and .5.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PlayerConnect(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Called on clients when a player connects.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PlayerDisconnect(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Called when a player disconnects.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnEnterWorld(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Called on the LocalPlayer when that player enters the world. SP and Client. Only called on the player who is entering. A possible use is ensuring that UI elements are reset to the configuration specified in data saved to the ModPlayer. Can also be used for informational messages.
member.param: The player that entered the world.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.OnRespawn(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Called when a player respawns in the world.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ShiftClickSlot(Terraria.Item[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called whenever the player shift-clicks an item slot. This can be used to override default clicking behavior (ie. selling or trashing items).
member.param: The array of items the slot is part of.
The index in the inventory of the clicked slot.
member.returns: Whether or not to block the default code (sell and trash) from running. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostSellItem(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Item[],Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Called whenever the player sells an item to an NPC.
member.param: The current inventory of the NPC shop.
The item the player just sold.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanSellItem(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Item[],Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Return false to prevent a transaction. Called before the transaction.
member.param: The current inventory of the NPC shop.
The item the player is attempting to sell.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.PostBuyItem(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Item[],Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Called whenever the player buys an item from an NPC.
member.param: The current inventory of the NPC shop.
The item the player just purchased.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.CanBuyItem(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Item[],Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Return false to prevent a transaction. Called before the transaction.
member.param: The current inventory of the NPC shop.
The item the player is attempting to buy.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyNurseHeal(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@,System.String@)
member.summary: Called on the Client while the nurse chat is displayed. Return false to prevent the player from healing. If you return false, you need to set chatText so the user knows why they can't heal.
member.param: How much health the player gains.
If set to false, debuffs will not be healed.
Set this to the Nurse chat text that will display if healing is prevented.
member.returns: True by default. False to prevent nurse services.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPlayer.ModifyNursePrice(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Called on the Client while the nurse chat is displayed and after ModifyNurseHeal. Allows custom pricing for Nurse services. See https://terraria.gamepedia.com/Nurse for the default pricing.
member.param: How much health the player gains.
Whether or not debuffs will be healed.

members.member:
Called on the Client after the player heals themselves with the Nurse NPC.
The Nurse npc providing the heal. How much health the player gained. /// Whether or not debuffs were healed. The price the player paid in copper coins.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.GetPrefix(System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns the ModPrefix associated with specified type If not a ModPrefix, returns null.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.GetPrefixesInCategory(Terraria.ModLoader.PrefixCategory)
member.summary: Returns a list of all modded prefixes of a certain category.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.Roll(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@,System.Int32,Terraria.ModLoader.PrefixCategory[])
member.summary: Performs a mod prefix roll. If the vanillaWeight wins the roll, then prefix is unchanged.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.RollChance(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: The roll chance of your prefix relative to a vanilla prefix, 1f by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.CanRoll(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Returns if your ModPrefix can roll on the given item By default returns RollChance(item) > 0

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.Category
member.summary: The category your prefix belongs to, PrefixCategory.Custom by default

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set the prefix's name/translations and to set its category.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.SetStats(System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Sets the stat changes for this prefix. If data is not already pre-stored, it is best to store custom data changes to some static variables.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.ValidateItem(Terraria.Item,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Validates whether this prefix with the custom data stats set from SetStats is allowed on the given item. It is not allowed if one of the stat changes do not cause any change (eg. percentage being too small to make a difference).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.Apply(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Applies the custom data stats set in SetStats to the given item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPrefix.ModifyValue(System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the sell price of the item based on the prefix or changes in custom data stats. This also influences the item's rarity.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.PrefixCategory.Melee
member.summary: Can modify the size of the weapon

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.PrefixCategory.Ranged
member.summary: Can modify the shoot speed of the weapon

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.PrefixCategory.Magic
member.summary: Can modify the mana usage of the weapon

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.PrefixCategory.Custom
member.summary: Will not appear by default. Useful as prefixes for your own damage type.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile
member.summary: This class serves as a place for you to place all your properties and hooks for each projectile. Create instances of ModProjectile (preferably overriding this class) to pass as parameters to Mod.AddProjectile.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.projectile
member.summary: The projectile object that this ModProjectile controls.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.mod
member.summary: The mod object that this ModProjectile originates from.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this ModProjectile.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.DisplayName
member.summary: The translations for the display name of this projectile.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.Texture
member.summary: The file name of this projectile's texture file in the mod loader's file space.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.GlowTexture
member.summary: The file name of this projectile's glow texture file in the mod loader's file space. If it does not exist it is ignored.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.aiType
member.summary: Determines which type of vanilla projectile this ModProjectile will copy the behavior (AI) of. Leave as 0 to not copy any behavior. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.cooldownSlot
member.summary: Determines which of the player's cooldown counters to use (-1, 0, or 1) when this projectile damages it. Defaults to -1.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.drawOffsetX
member.summary: How far to the right of its position this projectile should be drawn. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.drawOriginOffsetY
member.summary: The vertical origin offset from the projectile's center when it is drawn. The origin is essentially the point of rotation. This field will also determine the vertical drawing offset of the projectile.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.drawOriginOffsetX
member.summary: The horizontal origin offset from the projectile's center when it is drawn.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.drawHeldProjInFrontOfHeldItemAndArms
member.summary: If this projectile is held by the player, determines whether it is drawn in front of or behind the player's arms. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically load a projectile instead of using Mod.AddProjectile. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this method to either force or stop an autoload, or to change the default internal name.
member.returns: Whether or not to autoload.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CloneNewInstances
member.summary: Whether instances of this ModProjectile are created through a memberwise clone or its constructor. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.Clone
member.summary: Returns a clone of this ModProjectile. Allows you to decide which fields of your ModProjectile class are copied over when a new Projectile is created. By default this will return a memberwise clone; you will want to override this if your ModProjectile contains object references. Only called if CloneNewInstances is set to true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.NewInstance(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Create a new instance of this ModProjectile for a Projectile instance. Called at the end of Projectile.SetDefaults. If CloneNewInstances is true, just calls Clone() Otherwise calls the default constructor and copies fields

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set all your projectile's properties, such as width, damage, aiStyle, penetrate, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.SetStaticDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set all your projectile's static properties, such as names/translations and the arrays in ProjectileID.Sets.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.AutoStaticDefaults
member.summary: Automatically sets certain static defaults. Override this if you do not want the properties to be set for you.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.PreAI
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this projectile behaves. Return false to stop the vanilla AI and the AI hook from being run. Returns true by default.
member.returns: Whether or not to stop other AI.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.AI
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this projectile behaves. This will only be called if PreAI returns true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.PostAI
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this projectile behaves. This will be called regardless of what PreAI returns.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.SendExtraAI(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: If you are storing AI information outside of the projectile.ai array, use this to send that AI information between clients and servers.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.ReceiveExtraAI(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Use this to receive information that was sent in SendExtraAI.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.ShouldUpdatePosition
member.summary: Whether or not this projectile should update its position based on factors such as its velocity, whether it is in liquid, etc. Return false to make its velocity have no effect on its position. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.TileCollideStyle(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this projectile interacts with tiles. Width and height determine the projectile's hitbox for tile collision, and default to -1. Leave them as -1 to use the projectile's real size. Fallthrough determines whether the projectile can fall through platforms, etc., and defaults to true.
member.param: If the projectile can fall through platforms etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.OnTileCollide(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Allows you to determine what happens when this projectile collides with a tile. OldVelocity is the velocity before tile collision. The velocity that takes tile collision into account can be found with projectile.velocity. Return true to allow the vanilla tile collision code to take place (which normally kills the projectile). Returns true by default.
member.param: The velocity of the projectile upon collision.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CanCutTiles
member.summary: Return true or false to specify if the projectile can cut tiles, like vines. Return null for vanilla decision.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CutTiles
member.summary: Code ran when the projectile cuts tiles. Only runs if CanCutTiles() returns true. Useful when programming lasers and such.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.PreKill(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether the vanilla code for Kill and the Kill hook will be called. Return false to stop them from being called. Returns true by default. Note that this does not stop the projectile from dying.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.Kill(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to control what happens when this projectile is killed (for example, creating dust or making sounds). Also useful for creating retrievable ammo. Called on all clients and the server in multiplayer, so be sure to use `if (projectile.owner == Main.myPlayer)` if you are spawning retrievable ammo. (As seen in ExampleJavelinProjectile)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CanDamage
member.summary: Whether or not this projectile is capable of killing tiles (such as grass) and damaging NPCs/players. Return false to prevent it from doing any sort of damage. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.MinionContactDamage
member.summary: Whether or not this minion can damage NPCs by touching them. Returns false by default. Note that this will only be used if this projectile is considered a pet.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.ModifyDamageHitbox(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle@)
member.summary: Allows you to change the hitbox used by this projectile for damaging players and NPCs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CanHitNPC(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this projectile can hit the given NPC. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block this projectile from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this projectile does to an NPC. This method is only called for the owner of the projectile, meaning that in multi-player, projectiles owned by a player call this method on that client, and projectiles owned by the server such as enemy projectiles call this method on the server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.OnHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this projectile hits an NPC (for example, inflicting debuffs). This method is only called for the owner of the projectile, meaning that in multi-player, projectiles owned by a player call this method on that client, and projectiles owned by the server such as enemy projectiles call this method on the server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CanHitPvp(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this projectile can hit the given opponent player. Return false to block this projectile from hitting the target. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.ModifyHitPvp(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that this projectile does to an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.OnHitPvp(Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this projectile hits an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CanHitPlayer(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this hostile projectile can hit the given player. Return false to block this projectile from hitting the target. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.ModifyHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that this hostile projectile does to a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.OnHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this hostile projectile hits a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.Colliding(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Allows you to use custom collision detection between this projectile and a player or NPC that this projectile can damage. Useful for things like diagonal lasers, projectiles that leave a trail behind them, etc.
member.returns: Whether they collide or not.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.GetAlpha(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the color and transparency in which this projectile is drawn. Return null to use the default color (normally light and buff color). Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.PreDrawExtras(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind this projectile. Returns false to stop the game from drawing extras textures related to the projectile (for example, the chains for grappling hooks), useful if you're manually drawing the extras. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.PreDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind this projectile, or to modify the way this projectile is drawn. Return false to stop the game from drawing the projectile (useful if you're manually drawing the projectile). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.PostDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of a projectile. This method is called even if PreDraw returns false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.CanUseGrapple(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: This code is called whenever the player uses a grappling hook that shoots this type of projectile. Use it to change what kind of hook is fired (for example, the Dual Hook does this), to kill old hook projectiles, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.SingleGrappleHook(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Whether or not a grappling hook can only have one hook per player in the world at a time. Return null to use the vanilla code. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.UseGrapple(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This code is called whenever the player uses a grappling hook that shoots this type of projectile. Use it to change what kind of hook is fired (for example, the Dual Hook does this), to kill old hook projectiles, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.GrappleRange
member.summary: How far away this grappling hook can travel away from its player before it retracts.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.NumGrappleHooks(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: How many of this type of grappling hook the given player can latch onto blocks before the hooks start disappearing. Change the numHooks parameter to determine this; by default it will be 3.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.GrappleRetreatSpeed(Terraria.Player,System.Single@)
member.summary: The speed at which the grapple retreats back to the player after not hitting anything. Defaults to 11, but vanilla hooks go up to 24.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.GrapplePullSpeed(Terraria.Player,System.Single@)
member.summary: The speed at which the grapple pulls the player after hitting something. Defaults to 11, but the Bat Hook uses 16.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProjectile.DrawBehind(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: When used in conjunction with "projectile.hide = true", allows you to specify that this projectile should be drawn behind certain elements. Add the index to one and only one of the lists. For example, the Nebula Arcanum projectile draws behind NPCs and tiles.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProperties
member.summary: This is a struct that stores the properties of a mod. Without setting it in your Mod constructor, all properties default to true.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProperties.Autoload
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will autoload content by default. Autoloading content means you do not need to manually add content through methods.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProperties.AutoloadGores
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will automatically add images in the Gores folder as gores to the game, along with any ModGore classes that share names with the images. This means you do not need to manually call Mod.AddGore.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProperties.AutoloadSounds
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will automatically add sounds in the Sounds folder to the game. Place sounds in Sounds/Item to autoload them as item sounds, Sounds/NPCHit to add them as npcHit sounds, Sounds/NPCKilled to add them as npcKilled sounds, and Sounds/Music to add them as music tracks. Sounds placed anywhere else in the Sounds folder will be added as custom sounds. Any ModSound classes that share the same name as the sound files will be bound to them. Setting this field to true means that you do not need to manually call AddSound.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProperties.AutoloadBackgrounds
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will automatically add images in the Backgrounds folder as background textures to the game. This means you do not need to manually call Mod.AddBackgroundTexture.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModProperties.AutoLoadAll
member.summary: Automatically return a ModProperties object which has all AutoLoad values set to true.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe
member.summary:
This class extends Terraria.Recipe, meaning you can use it in a similar manner to vanilla recipes. However, it provides methods that simplify recipe creation. Recipes are added by creating new instances of ModRecipe, then calling the
method.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.RecipeIndex
member.summary: The index of the recipe in the Main.recipe array.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddIngredient(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an ingredient to this recipe with the given item type and stack size. Ex: recipe.AddIngredient(ItemID.IronAxe)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddIngredient(Terraria.ModLoader.Mod,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an ingredient to this recipe with the given item name from the given mod, and with the given stack stack. If the mod parameter is null, then it will automatically use an item from the mod creating this recipe.
member.exception: The item " + itemName + " does not exist in mod " + mod.Name + ". If you are trying to use a vanilla item, try removing the first argument.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddIngredient(Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an ingredient to this recipe of the given type of item and stack size.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddRecipeGroup(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a recipe group ingredient to this recipe with the given RecipeGroup name and stack size. Vanilla recipe groups consist of "Wood", "IronBar", "PresurePlate", "Sand", and "Fragment".
member.exception: A recipe group with the name " + name + " does not exist.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddRecipeGroup(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a recipe group ingredient to this recipe with the given RecipeGroupID and stack size. Vanilla recipe group IDs can be found in Terraria.ID.RecipeGroupID and modded recipe group IDs will be returned from RecipeGroup.RegisterGroup.
member.exception: A recipe group with the ID " + recipeGroupID + " does not exist.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddTile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a required crafting station with the given tile type to this recipe. Ex: recipe.AddTile(TileID.WorkBenches)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddTile(Terraria.ModLoader.Mod,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a required crafting station to this recipe with the given tile name from the given mod. If the mod parameter is null, then it will automatically use a tile from the mod creating this recipe.
