member.exception: The tile " + tileName + " does not exist in mod " + mod.Name + ". If you are trying to use a vanilla tile, try using ModRecipe.AddTile(tileID).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddTile(Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile)
member.summary: Adds a required crafting station to this recipe of the given type of tile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.SetCondition(System.Func{Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Sets a condition delegate that will determine whether or not the recipe will be to be available for the player to use. The condition can be unrelated to items or tiles (for example, biome or time).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.SetOnCraftCallback(System.Action{Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe,Terraria.Item})
member.summary: Sets a callback that will allow you to make anything happen when the recipe is used to create an item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.SetConsumeItemCallback(System.Func{Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32})
member.summary: Sets a callback that allows you to determine how many of a certain ingredient is consumed when this recipe is used. Return the number of ingredients that will actually be consumed. By default returns numRequired.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModRecipe.AddRecipe
member.summary: Adds this recipe to the game. Call this after you have finished setting the result, ingredients, etc.
member.exception: A recipe without any result has been added.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSide
member.summary: A ModSide enum defines how mods are synced between clients and servers. You can set your mod's ModSide from its build.txt file.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSide.Both
member.summary: The default value for ModSide. This means that the mod has effects both client-side and server-side. When a client connects to a server, this mod will be disabled if the server does not have it. If a client without this mod connects to a server with this mod, the server will send this mod to the client and enable it. In general all mods that add game content should use this.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSide.Client
member.summary: This means that the mod only has effects client-side. This mod will not be disabled client-side if the server does not have it. This is useful for mods that only add controls (for example, hotkeys), change textures/musics, etc.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSide.Server
member.summary: This means that the mod only has effects server-side. The server will not send this mod to every client that connects.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSide.NoSync
member.summary: This means that the mod could have effects client-side and could have effects server-side. The client will not download this mod if it connects to a server with this mod, and the client will not disable this mod if it connects to a server without this mod. If a client connects to a server and both have this mod, then IDs will still be synchronized. This is useful if you want optional extra features when both the client and server have this mod.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSound
member.summary: This class allows you to customize how a sound you add is played. To use this, pass an instance to Mod.AddSound, or if you are autoloading sounds, give an overriding class the same name as the file with the sound you are adding.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSound.Sound
member.summary: The SoundEffect instance of the sound that this ModSound controls. This is here so you can call CreateInstance on it.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSound.PlaySound(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffectInstance@,System.Single,System.Single,Terraria.ModLoader.SoundType)
member.summary: Override this hook to customize how this sound is played. If this sound is already currently playing, you have the option to call soundInstance.Stop(). You must eventually assign the result of sound.CreateInstance() to soundInstace. Afterwards, you can modify soundInstance.Volume, soundInstance.Pan, and soundInstance.Pitch to your liking. The default volume and pan have been passed as parameters. Volume measures loudness, pan measures how far to the left or right the sound is, and pitch measures the octave. Finally, call Main.PlaySoundInstance(soundInstance).

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile
member.summary: This class represents a type of tile that can be added by a mod. Only one instance of this class will ever exist for each type of tile that is added. Any hooks that are called will be called by the instance corresponding to the tile type. This is to prevent the game from using a massive amount of memory storing tile instances.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.mod
member.summary: The mod which has added this type of ModTile.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.Name
member.summary: The name of this type of tile.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.Type
member.summary: The internal ID of this type of tile.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.HighlightTexture
member.summary: The highlight texture used when this tile is selected by smart interact. Defaults to adding "_Highlight" onto the main texture.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.soundType
member.summary: The default type of sound made when this tile is hit. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.soundStyle
member.summary: The default style of sound made when this tile is hit. Defaults to 1.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.dustType
member.summary: The default type of dust made when this tile is hit. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.drop
member.summary: The default type of item dropped when this tile is killed. Defaults to 0, which means no item.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.animationFrameHeight
member.summary: The height of a group of animation frames for this tile. Defaults to 0, which disables animations.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.mineResist
member.summary: A multiplier describing how much this block resists harvesting. Higher values will make it take longer to harvest. Defaults to 1f.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.minPick
member.summary: The minimum pickaxe power required for pickaxes to mine this block. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.disableSmartCursor
member.summary: Whether or not the smart cursor function is disabled when the cursor hovers above this tile. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.disableSmartInteract
member.summary: Whether or not the smart tile interaction function is disabled when the cursor hovers above this tile. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.adjTiles
member.summary: An array of the IDs of tiles that this tile can be considered as when looking for crafting stations.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.closeDoorID
member.summary: The ID of the tile that this door transforms into when it is closed. Defaults to -1, which means this tile isn't a door.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.openDoorID
member.summary: The ID of the tile that this door transforms into when it is opened. Defaults to -1, which means this tile isn't a door.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.chest
member.summary: The default name of this chest that is displayed when this 2x2 chest is open. Defaults to the empty string, which means that this tile isn't a chest. Setting this field will make the tile behave like a chest (meteors will avoid it, tiles underneath cannot be mined, etc.), but you will have to manually give it storage capabilities yourself. (See the ExampleMod for something you can copy/paste.)

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.chestDrop
member.summary: The ID of the item that drops when this chest is destroyed. Defaults to 0. Honestly, this is only really used when the chest limit is reached on a server.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.dresser
member.summary: Same as chest, except use this if your block is a dresser (has a size of 3x2 instead of 2x2).

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.dresserDrop
member.summary: The ID of the item that drops when this dresser is destroyed. Defaults to 0. Honestly, this is only really used when the chest limit is reached on a server.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.bed
member.summary: Whether or not this tile is a valid spawn point. Defaults to false. If you set this to true, you will still have to manually set the spawn yourself in the RightClick hook.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.torch
member.summary: Whether or not this tile behaves like a torch. If you are making a torch tile, then setting this to true is necessary in order for tile placement, tile framing, and the item's smart selection to work properly.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.sapling
member.summary: Whether or not this tile is a sapling, which can grow into a modded tree or palm tree.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.AddToArray(System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: A convenient method for adding this tile's Type to the given array. This can be used with the arrays in TileID.Sets.RoomNeeds.

member.summary: Adds an entry to the minimap for this tile with the given color, default display name, and display name function. The parameters for the function are the default display name, x-coordinate, and y-coordinate. This should be called in SetDefaults.

member.summary: Allows you to customize which items the tile at the given coordinates drops. Remember that the x, y (i, j) coordinates are in tile coordinates, you will need to multiply them by 16 if you want to drop an item using them. Return false to stop the game from dropping the tile's default item. Returns true by default. Please note that this hook currently only works for 1x1 tiles.

The y position in tile coordinates.

member.summary: Allows you to determine what happens when the tile at the given coordinates is killed or hit with a pickaxe. Fail determines whether the tile is mined, effectOnly makes it so that only dust is created, and noItem stops items from dropping.

member.summary: Allows you to determine whether or not the tile will draw itself flipped in the world.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.SetDrawPositions(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize the position in which this tile is drawn. Width refers to the width of one frame of the tile, offsetY refers to how many pixels below its actual position the tile should be drawn, and height refers to the height of one frame of the tile. By default the values will be set to the values you give this tile's TileObjectData. If this tile has no TileObjectData then they will default to 16, 0, and 16, respectively.
member.param: The x position in tile coordinates.
The y position in tile coordinates.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.AnimateTile(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to animate your tile. Use frameCounter to keep track of how long the current frame has been active, and use frame to change the current frame. This is called once an update. Use AnimateIndividualTile to animate specific tile instances directly.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.AnimateIndividualTile(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Animates an individual tile. i and j are the coordinates of the Tile in question. frameXOffset and frameYOffset should be used to specify an offset from the tiles frameX and frameY. "frameYOffset = modTile.animationFrameHeight * Main.tileFrame[type];" will already be set before this hook is called, taking into account the TileID-wide animation set via AnimateTile. Use this hook for off-sync animations (lightning bug in a bottle), temporary animations (trap chests), or TileEntities to achieve unique animation behaviors without having to manually draw the tile via PreDraw.
member.param: The x position in tile coordinates.
The y position in tile coordinates.

member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind the tile at the given coordinates. Return false to stop the game from drawing the tile normally. Returns true by default.

The y position in tile coordinates.
The special draw count. Use with Main.specX and Main.specY and then increment to draw special things after the main tile drawing loop is complete via DrawSpecial.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.IsLockedChest(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return true if this Tile corresponds to a chest that is locked. Prevents Quick Stacking items into the chest.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTile.UnlockChest(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int16@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows customization of how a chest unlock is accomplished. By default, frameXAdjustment will be -36, shifting the frameX over to the left by 1 chest style. If your chests are in a different order, adjust frameXAdjustment accordingly. This hook is called on the client, and if successful will be called on the server and other clients as the action is synced. Make sure that the logic is consistent and not dependent on local player data.
member.param: The x position in tile coordinates.
The y position in tile coordinates.
The adjustment made to each Tile.frameX, defaults to -36
Set this to true to bypass the code playing the unlock sound, adjusting the tile frame, and spawning dust. Network syncing will still happen.
member.returns: Return true if this tile truly is a locked chest and the chest can be unlocked

member.summary: Don't use this. It is included only for completion's sake.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically load a tile entity instead of using Mod.AddTileEntity. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this method to either force or stop an autoload, or change the default display name.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.Save
member.summary: Allows you to save custom data for this tile entity.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.Load(Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary: Allows you to load the custom data you have saved for this tile entity.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.NetSend(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to send custom data for this tile entity between client and server. This is called on the server while sending tile data (!lightSend) and when a MessageID.TileEntitySharing message is sent (lightSend)
member.param: If true, send only data that can change. Otherwise, send the full information.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.NetReceive(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Receives the data sent in the NetSend hook. Called on MP Client when receiving tile data (!lightReceive) and when a MessageID.TileEntitySharing message is sent (lightReceive)
member.param: If true, read only data that can change. Otherwise, read the full information.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.ValidTile(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Whether or not this tile entity is allowed to survive at the given coordinates. You should check whether the tile is active, as well as the tile's type and frame.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.Hook_AfterPlacement(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method does not get called by tModLoader, and is only included for you convenience so you do not have to cast the result of Mod.GetTileEntity.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.OnNetPlace
member.summary: Code that should be run when this tile entity is placed by means of server-syncing. Called on Server only.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.PreGlobalUpdate
member.summary: Code that should be run before all tile entities in the world update.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.PostGlobalUpdate
member.summary: Code that should be run after all tile entities in the world update.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTileEntity.OnKill
member.summary: This method only gets called in the Kill method. If you plan to use that, you can put code here to make things happen when it is called.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall
member.summary: This class represents a type of wall that can be added by a mod. Only one instance of this class will ever exist for each type of wall that is added. Any hooks that are called will be called by the instance corresponding to the wall type.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.mod
member.summary: The mod which has added this type of ModWall.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.Name
member.summary: The name of this type of wall.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.Type
member.summary: The internal ID of this type of wall.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.soundType
member.summary: The default type of sound made when this wall is hit. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.soundStyle
member.summary: The default style of sound made when this wall is hit. Defaults to 1.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.dustType
member.summary: The default type of dust made when this wall is hit. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.drop
member.summary: The default type of item dropped when this wall is killed. Defaults to 0, which means no item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.AddMapEntry(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Terraria.Localization.LocalizedText)
member.summary: Adds an entry to the minimap for this wall with the given color and display name. This should be called in SetDefaults.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.CreateMapEntryName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ModTranslation object that you can use in AddMapEntry.
member.param: The key for the ModTranslation. The full key will be MapObject.ModName.key

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.AddMapEntry(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Terraria.ModLoader.ModTranslation)
member.summary: Adds an entry to the minimap for this wall with the given color and display name. This should be called in SetDefaults.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.AddMapEntry(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Terraria.Localization.LocalizedText,System.Func{System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String})
member.summary: Adds an entry to the minimap for this wall with the given color, default display name, and display name function. The parameters for the function are the default display name, x-coordinate, and y-coordinate. This should be called in SetDefaults.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.AddMapEntry(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Terraria.ModLoader.ModTranslation,System.Func{System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String})
member.summary: Adds an entry to the minimap for this wall with the given color, default display name, and display name function. The parameters for the function are the default display name, x-coordinate, and y-coordinate. This should be called in SetDefaults.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.Autoload(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the name and texture path of this wall when it is autoloaded. Return true to autoload this wall. When a wall is autoloaded, that means you do not need to manually call Mod.AddWall. By default returns the mod's autoload property.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set the properties of this wall. Many properties are stored as arrays throughout Terraria's code.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.KillSound(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to customize which sound you want to play when the wall at the given coordinates is hit. Return false to stop the game from playing its default sound for the wall. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.NumDust(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change how many dust particles are created when the wall at the given coordinates is hit.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.CreateDust(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the default type of dust created when the wall at the given coordinates is hit. Return false to stop the default dust (the type parameter) from being created. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.Drop(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize which items the wall at the given coordinates drops. Return false to stop the game from dropping the tile's default item (the type parameter). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.KillWall(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine what happens when the tile at the given coordinates is killed or hit with a hammer. Fail determines whether the tile is mined (whether it is killed).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.CanExplode(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Whether or not the wall at the given coordinates can be killed by an explosion (ie. bombs). Returns true by default; return false to stop an explosion from destroying it.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.GetMapOption(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to choose which minimap entry the wall at the given coordinates will use. 0 is the first entry added by AddMapEntry, 1 is the second entry, etc. Returns 0 by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.ModifyLight(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how much light this wall emits. This can also let you light up the block in front of this wall.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.RandomUpdate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called whenever the world randomly decides to update the tile containing this wall in a given tick. Useful for things such as growing or spreading.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.AnimateWall(System.Byte@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Allows you to animate your wall. Use frameCounter to keep track of how long the current frame has been active, and use frame to change the current frame.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.PreDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind the wall at the given coordinates. Return false to stop the game from drawing the wall normally. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.PostDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of the wall at the given coordinates.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWall.PlaceInWorld(System.Int32,System.Int32,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Called after this wall is placed in the world by way of the item provided.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle
member.summary: Represents a style of water that gets drawn, based on factors such as the background. This is used to determine the color of the water, as well as other things as determined by the hooks below.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.mod
member.summary: The mod that added this style of water.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this water style.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.Type
member.summary: The ID of the water style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.Autoload(System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a ModWaterStyle instead of using Mod.AddWaterStyle. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name, and texture is initialized to the namespace and overriding class name with periods replaced with slashes. BlockTexture is initialized to texture with "_Block" added at the end. Use this to either force or stop an autoload, change the name that identifies this type of ModWaterStyle, and/or change the texture paths used by this ModWaterStyle.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.ChooseWaterStyle
member.summary: Whether the conditions have been met for this water style to be used. Typically Main.bgStyle is checked to determine whether a water style should be used. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.ChooseWaterfallStyle
member.summary: The ID of the waterfall style the game should use when this water style is in use.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.GetSplashDust
member.summary: The ID of the dust that is created when anything splashes in water.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.GetDropletGore
member.summary: The ID of the gore that represents droplets of water falling down from a block.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.LightColorMultiplier(System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the light levels of the tiles behind the water. The light color components will be multiplied by the parameters.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterStyle.BiomeHairColor
member.summary: Allows you to change the hair color resulting from the biome hair dye when this water style is in use.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterfallStyle
member.summary: Represents a style of waterfalls that gets drawn. This is mostly used to determine the color of the waterfall.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterfallStyle.mod
member.summary: The mod that added this style of waterfall.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterfallStyle.Name
member.summary: The internal name of this waterfall style.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterfallStyle.Type
member.summary: The ID of this waterfall style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterfallStyle.Autoload(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a ModWaterfallStyle instead of using Mod.AddWaterfallStyle. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name, and texture is initialized to the namespace and overriding class name with periods replaced with slashes. Use this to either force or stop an autoload, change the name that identifies this type of ModWaterStyle, or change the texture path used by this ModWaterfallStyle.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterfallStyle.AddLight(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to create light at a tile occupied by a waterfall of this style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWaterfallStyle.ColorMultiplier(System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the color multiplier acting on waterfalls of this style. Useful for waterfalls whose colors change over time.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld
member.summary: A ModWorld instance represents an extension of a World. You can store fields in the ModWorld classes to keep track of mod-specific information on the world. It also contains hooks to insert your code into the world generation process.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.mod
member.summary: The mod that added this type of ModWorld.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.Name
member.summary: The name of this ModWorld. Used for distinguishing between multiple ModWorlds added by a single Mod.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.Autoload(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to automatically add a ModWorld instead of using Mod.AddModWorld. Return true to allow autoloading; by default returns the mod's autoload property. Name is initialized to the overriding class name. Use this to either force or stop an autoload, or change the name that identifies this type of ModWorld.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.Initialize
member.summary: Called whenever the world is loaded. This can be used to initialize data structures, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.Save
member.summary: Allows you to save custom data for this world. Useful for things like saving world specific flags. For example, if your mod adds a boss and you want certain NPC to only spawn once it has been defeated, this is where you would store the information that that boss has been defeated in this world. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.Load(Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary: Allows you to load custom data you have saved for this world.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.LoadLegacy(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Allows you to load pre-v0.9 custom data you have saved for this world.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.NetSend(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Allows you to send custom data between clients and server. This is useful for syncing information such as bosses that have been defeated.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.NetReceive(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Allows you to do things with custom data that is received between clients and server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.PreWorldGen
member.summary: Allows a mod to run code before a world is generated.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.ModifyWorldGenTasks(System.Collections.Generic.List{Terraria.WorldBuilding.GenPass},System.Single@)
member.summary: A more advanced option to PostWorldGen, this method allows you modify the list of Generation Passes before a new world begins to be generated. For example, removing the "Planting Trees" pass will cause a world to generate without trees. Placing a new Generation Pass before the "Dungeon" pass will prevent the the mod's pass from cutting into the dungeon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.PostWorldGen
member.summary: Use this method to place tiles in the world after world generation is complete.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.ResetNearbyTileEffects
member.summary: Use this to reset any fields you set in any of your ModTile.NearbyEffects hooks back to their default values.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.PreUpdate
member.summary: Use this method to have things happen in the world. In vanilla Terraria, a good example of code suitable for this hook is how Falling Stars fall to the ground during the night. This hook is called every frame.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.PostUpdate
member.summary: Use this method to have things happen in the world. In vanilla Terraria, a good example of code suitable for this hook is how Falling Stars fall to the ground during the night. This hook is called every frame.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.TileCountsAvailable(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Allows you to store information about how many of each tile is nearby the player. This is useful for counting how many tiles of a certain custom biome there are. The tileCounts parameter stores the tile count indexed by tile type.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.ChooseWaterStyle(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change the water style (determines water color) that is currently being used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.ModifyHardmodeTasks(System.Collections.Generic.List{Terraria.WorldBuilding.GenPass})
member.summary: Similar to ModifyWorldGenTasks, but occurs in-game when Hardmode starts. Can be used to modify which tasks should be done and/or add custom tasks. By default the list will only contain 4 items, the vanilla hardmode tasks called "Hardmode Good", "Hardmode Evil", "Hardmode Walls", and "Hardmode Announcment"

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModWorld.PostDrawTiles
member.summary: Called after drawing Tiles. Can be used for drawing a tile overlay akin to wires. Note that spritebatch should be begun and ended within this method.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.MountLoader
member.summary: This serves as the central place from which mounts are stored and mount-related functions are carried out.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.MountLoader.GetMount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the ModMountData instance corresponding to the given type. Returns null if no ModMountData has the given type.
member.returns: Null if not found, otherwise the ModMountData associated with the mount.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.MountLoader.UseAbility(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen while the mouse is pressed while the mount is active. Called each tick the mouse is pressed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.MountLoader.AimAbility(Terraria.Mount,Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the mount ability is aiming (while charging).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.MountLoader.SetMount(Terraria.Mount,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this mount is spawned in. Useful for player-specific initialization, utilizing player.mount._mountSpecificData or a ModPlayer class since ModMountData is shared between all players. Custom dust spawning logic is also possible via the skipDust parameter.
member.param: Set to true to skip the vanilla dust spawning logic

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.MountLoader.Dismount(Terraria.Mount,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this mount is de-spawned. Useful for player-specific cleanup, see SetMount. Custom dust spawning logic is also possible via the skipDust parameter.
member.param: Set to true to skip the vanilla dust spawning logic

member.summary: See

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.MountTextureType
member.summary: This is an enum of all possible types of extra mount textures for custom mounts. Use these as keys in the extraTextures dictionary passed to Mod.AddMount to give your mount front and back textures.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority
member.summary: This enum dictates from low to high which music selections take priority. Setting appropriate MusicPriority values in Mod.UpdateMusic is important so that your mod works well with other mods and vanilla music selections.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.None
member.summary: Represents no priority

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.BiomeLow
member.summary: Hallow, Ocean, Desert, Overworld, Night

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.BiomeMedium
member.summary: Dungeon, Meteor, Jungle, Snow

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.BiomeHigh
member.summary: Temple, Mushrooms, Corruption, Crimson,

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.Environment
member.summary: Sandstorm, Hell, Above surface during Eclipse, Space

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.Event
member.summary: Pirate Invasion, Goblin Invasion, Old Ones Army

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.BossLow
member.summary: All other bosses and default modded boss priority

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.BossMedium
member.summary: Martian Madness, Celestial Towers, Plantera

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.MusicPriority.BossHigh
member.summary: Moon Lord

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCHeadLoader
member.summary: This class serves as a central place from which NPC head slots are stored and NPC head textures are assigned. This can be used to obtain the corresponding slots to head textures.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCHeadLoader.VanillaHeadCount
member.summary: The number of vanilla town NPC head textures that exist.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCHeadLoader.VanillaBossHeadCount
member.summary: The number of vanilla boss head textures that exist.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCHeadLoader.GetHeadSlot(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the index of the head texture corresponding to the given texture path.
member.returns: The index of the texture in the heads array, -1 if not found.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCHeadLoader.GetBossHeadSlot(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the index of the boss head texture corresponding to the given texture path.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCLoader
member.summary: This serves as the central class from which NPC-related functions are carried out. It also stores a list of mod NPCs by ID.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCLoader.blockLoot
member.summary: Allows you to stop an NPC from dropping loot by adding item IDs to this list. This list will be cleared whenever NPCLoot ends. Useful for either removing an item or change the drop rate of an item in the NPC's loot table. To change the drop rate of an item, use the PreNPCLoot hook, spawn the item yourself, then add the item's ID to this list.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCLoader.GetNPC(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the ModNPC instance corresponding to the specified type.
member.returns: The ModNPC instance in the npcs array, null if not found.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnHelper
member.summary: This server as a central class to help modders spawn their npcs. It's basically the vanilla spawn code if-else chains condensed into objects. See ExampleMod for usages.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo
member.summary: A struct that stores information regarding where an NPC is naturally spawning and the player it is spawning around. This serves to reduce the parameter count for ModNPC.CanSpawn and GlobalNPC.EditSpawnPool.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.spawnTileX
member.summary: The x-coordinate of the tile the NPC will spawn above.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.spawnTileY
member.summary: The y-coordinate of the tile the NPC will spawn above.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.player
member.summary:
The player that this NPC is spawning around. For convenience, here are the player zones, which are also useful for determining NPC spawn:
ZoneDungeon
ZoneCorrupt
ZoneHoly
ZoneMeteor
ZoneJungle
ZoneSnow
ZoneCrimson
ZoneWaterCandle
ZonePeaceCandle
ZoneTowerSolar
ZoneTowerVortex
ZoneTowerNebula
ZoneTowerStardust
ZoneDesert
ZoneGlowshroom
ZoneUndergroundDesert
ZoneSkyHeight
ZoneOverworldHeight
ZoneDirtLayerHeight
ZoneRockLayerHeight
ZoneUnderworldHeight
ZoneBeach
ZoneRain
ZoneSandstorm

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.playerFloorX
member.summary: The x-coordinate of the tile the player is standing on.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.playerFloorY
member.summary: The y-coordinate of the tile the player is standing on.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.sky
member.summary: Whether or not the player is in the sky biome, where harpies and wyverns spawn.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.lihzahrd
member.summary: Whether or not the player is inside the jungle temple, where Lihzahrds spawn.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.playerSafe
member.summary: Whether or not the player is in front of a player-placed wall or in a large town. If this is true, enemies that can attack through walls should not spawn (unless an invasion is in progress).

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.invasion
member.summary: Whether or not there is an invasion going on and the player is near it.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.water
member.summary: Whether or not the tile the NPC will spawn in contains water.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.granite
member.summary: Whether or not the NPC will spawn on a granite block or the player is near a granite biome.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.marble
member.summary: Whether or not the NPC will spawn on a marble block or the player is near a marble biome.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.spiderCave
member.summary: Whether or not the player is in a spider cave or the NPC will spawn near one.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.playerInTown
member.summary: Whether or not the player is in a town. This is used for spawning critters instead of monsters.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.desertCave
member.summary: Whether or not the player is in front of a desert wall or the NPC will spawn near one.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.planteraDefeated
member.summary: Whether Plantera is defeated and the world is in hardmode. This isn't needed (it's easy to find by yourself), but it's a local flag in NPC.SpawnNPC, so it is included for completeness.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo.safeRangeX
member.summary: Whether or not the NPC is horizontally within the range near the player in which NPCs cannot spawn. If this is true, it also means that it is vertically outside of the range near the player in which NPCs cannot spawn.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.PlayerHooks
member.summary: This is where all ModPlayer hooks are gathered and called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.PlayerHooks.ModifyWeaponDamage(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calls ModItem.HookModifyWeaponDamage, then all GlobalItem.HookModifyWeaponDamage hooks.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ProjectileLoader
member.summary: This serves as the central class from which projectile-related functions are carried out. It also stores a list of mod projectiles by ID.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ProjectileLoader.GetProjectile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the ModProjectile instance corresponding to the specified type.
member.returns: The ModProjectile instance in the projectiles array, null if not found.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor
member.summary: This class allows you to make any changes you want to a recipe, whether it be adding/removing ingredients, changing the result, or removing the recipe entirely.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.#ctor(Terraria.Recipe)
member.summary: Creates a recipe editor that acts on the given recipe.
member.param: The recipe this RecipeEditor should focus on.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.AddIngredient(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an ingredient with the given item ID and stack size to the recipe. If the recipe already contains the ingredient, it will increase the stack requirement instead. Can also throw a RecipeException.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.SetIngredientStack(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the stack requirement of the ingredient with the given item ID in the recipe. Returns true if the operation was successful. Returns false if the recipe does not contain the ingredient. Can also throw a RecipeException.
member.param: The item ID of the ingredient to set the stack on.
member.returns: Whether the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.DeleteIngredient(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the ingredient requirement with the given ID from the recipe. Returns true if the operation was successful. Returns false if the recipe did not contain the ingredient in the first place. Can also throw a RecipeException.
member.param: The item ID of the ingredient to delete.
member.returns: Whether the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.AcceptRecipeGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the recipe group with the given name to the recipe. Note that, unlike ModRecipe and RecipeFinder, this won't actually add an ingredient; it will only allow existing ingredients to be interchangeable with other items. Returns true if the operation was successful. Returns false if the recipe already accepts the given recipe group. Can also throw a RecipeException.
member.returns: Whether adding the recipegroup was successful.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.RejectRecipeGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the recipe group with the given name from the recipe. This is the opposite of AcceptRecipeGroup; while it won't remove ingredients, it will make existing ingredients no longer be interchangeable with other items. Returns true if the operation was successful. Returns false if the recipe did not contain the recipe group in the first place. Can also throw a RecipeException.
member.returns: Whether removing the recipegroup was successful.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.SetResult(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A convenience method for setting the result of the recipe. Similar to calling recipe.createItem.SetDefaults(itemID), followed by recipe.createItem.stack = stack. Can also throw a RecipeException.
member.param: The ID of the item to set as result.
The stack of the item to set as result.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.AddTile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the crafting station with the given tile ID to the recipe. Returns true if the operation was successful. Returns false if the recipe already requires the given tile. Can also throw a RecipeException.
member.returns: Whether the operation was successful

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.DeleteTile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the crafting station with the given tile ID as a requirement from the recipe. Returns true if the operation was successful. Returns false if the recipe did not require the tile in the first place. Can also throw a RecipeException.
member.returns: Whether the operation was successful or not.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.SetNeedWater(System.Boolean)
member.summary: A convenience method for setting recipe.needWater.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.SetNeedLava(System.Boolean)
member.summary: A convenience method for setting recipe.needLava.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.SetNeedHoney(System.Boolean)
member.summary: A convenience method for setting recipe.needHoney.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeEditor.DeleteRecipe
member.summary: Completely removes the recipe from the game, making it unusable. Returns true if the operation was successful. Returns false if the recipe was already not in the game.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder
member.summary: This class will search through all existing recipes for you based on criteria that you give it. It's useful for finding a particular vanilla recipe that you wish to remove or edit. Use this by creating new instances with the empty constructor for each search you perform.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.needWater
member.summary: Adds the requirement of being nearby water to the search criteria. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.needLava
member.summary: Adds the requirement of being nearby lava to the search criteria. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.needHoney
member.summary: Adds the requirement of being nearby honey to the search criteria. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.AddIngredient(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an ingredient with the given item type and stack size to the search criteria.
member.param: The item ID of the ingredient to add.
The stack of the ingredient to add.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.AddRecipeGroup(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a recipe group ingredient with the given RecipeGroup name and stack size to the search criteria.
member.param: The name of the recipegroup to accept.
The stack of the recipegroup to accept.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.AddRecipeGroup(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a recipe group ingredient with the given RecipeGroupID and stack size to the search criteria.
member.param: The RecipeGroupID of the recipegroup to accept.
The stack of the recipegroup to accept.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.SetResult(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria's result to the given item type and stack size.
member.param: The item ID of the item to set as result.
The stack of the item to set as result.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.AddTile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a required crafting station with the given tile type to the search criteria.
member.param: The tile ID of the tile to add.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.FindExactRecipe
member.summary: Searches for a recipe that matches the search criteria exactly, then returns it. That means the recipe will have exactly the same ingredients, tiles, liquid requirements, recipe groups, and result; even the stack sizes will match. If no recipe with an exact match is found, this will return null.
member.returns: The recipe found matching the finder's criteria.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeFinder.SearchRecipes
member.summary: Searches for all recipes that include the search criteria, then returns them in a list. In terms of ingredients, it will search for recipes that include all the search criteria ingredients, with stack sizes greater than or equal to the search criteria. It will also make sure the recipes include all search criteria recipe groups and tiles. If the search criteria includes a result, the recipes will also have the same result with a stack size greater than or equal to the search criteria. Finally, if needWater, needLava, or needHoney are set to true, the found recipes will also have them set to true.
member.returns: A list containing found recipes matching the finder's criteria.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeHooks
member.summary: This is where all ModRecipe and GlobalRecipe hooks are gathered and called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeHooks.RecipeAvailable(Terraria.Recipe)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the conditions are met for this recipe to be available for the player to use.
member.returns: Whether or not the conditions are met for this recipe.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.RecipeHooks.OnCraft(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Recipe)
member.summary: Allows you to make anything happen when a player uses this recipe.
member.param: The recipe used to craft the item.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.SoundLoader
member.summary: This class is used to keep track of and support the existence of custom sounds that have been added to the game.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.SoundLoader.customSoundType
member.summary: This value should be passed as the first parameter to Main.PlaySound whenever you want to play a custom sound that is not an item, npcHit, or npcKilled sound.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.SoundLoader.GetSoundSlot(Terraria.ModLoader.SoundType,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the style (last parameter passed to Main.PlaySound) of the sound corresponding to the given SoundType and the given sound file path. Returns 0 if there is no corresponding style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.SoundLoader.GetLegacySoundSlot(Terraria.ModLoader.SoundType,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a LegacySoundStyle object which encapsulates both a sound type and a sound style (This is the new way to do sounds in 1.3.4) Returns null if there is no corresponding style.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.SoundType
member.summary: This is an enum of the types of sound you can add to the game. This is used for determining whether a sound is a music or a sound effect. If it's a sound effect, it's also used for determining the "type" passed to Main.PlaySound (first parameter) that is required in order for a sound to play; 2 for item sounds, 3 for npcHit sounds, 4 for npcKilled sounds, and SoundLoader.customSoundType for anything else.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.TileLoader
member.summary: This serves as the central class from which tile-related functions are supported and carried out.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.TileLoader.GetTile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the ModTile instance with the given type. If no ModTile with the given type exists, returns null.
member.returns: The ModTile instance in the tiles array, null if not found.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.TileLoader.SetAnimationFrame(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Sets the animation frame. Sets frameYOffset = modTile.animationFrameHeight * Main.tileFrame[type]; and then calls ModTile.AnimateIndividualTile
member.param: The x position in tile coordinates.
The y position in tile coordinates.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.TileLoader.SpecialDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Special Draw calls ModTile and GlobalTile SpecialDraw methods. Special Draw is called from DrawTiles after the draw loop, allowing for basically another layer above tiles. Main.specX and Main.specY are used to specify tiles to call SpecialDraw on. Use DrawEffects hook to queue for SpecialDraw.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine
member.summary: This class serves as a way to store information about a line of tooltip for an item. You will create and manipulate objects of this class if you use the ModifyTooltips hook.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine.mod
member.summary: The name of the mod adding this tooltip line. This will be "Terraria" for all vanilla tooltip lines.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine.Name
member.summary: The name of the tooltip, used to help you identify its function.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine.text
member.summary: The actual text that this tooltip displays.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine.isModifier
member.summary: Whether or not this tooltip gives prefix information. This will make it so that the tooltip is colored either green or red.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine.isModifierBad
member.summary: If isModifier is true, this determines whether the tooltip is colored green or red.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine.overrideColor
member.summary: This completely overrides the color the tooltip is drawn in. If it is set to null (the default value) then the tooltip's color will not be overridden.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.TooltipLine.#ctor(Terraria.ModLoader.Mod,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a tooltip line object with the given mod, identifier name, and text.
These are the names of the vanilla tooltip lines, in the order in which they appear, along with their functions. All of them will have a mod name of "Terraria". Remember that most of these tooltip lines will not exist depending on the item.
"ItemName" - The name of the item.
"Favorite" - Tells if the item is favorited.
"FavoriteDesc" - Tells what it means when an item is favorited.
"Social" - Tells if the item is in a social slot.
"SocialDesc" - Tells what it means for an item to be in a social slot.
"Damage" - The damage value and type of the weapon.
"CritChance" - The critical strike chance of the weapon.
"Speed" - The use speed of the weapon.
"Knockback" - The knockback of the weapon.
"FishingPower" - Tells the fishing power of the fishing pole.
"NeedsBait" - Tells that a fishing pole requires bait.
"BaitPower" - The bait power of the bait.
"Equipable" - Tells that an item is equipable.
"WandConsumes" - Tells what item a tile wand consumes.
"Quest" - Tells that this is a quest item.
"Vanity" - Tells that this is a vanity item.
"Defense" - Tells how much defense the item gives when equipped.
"PickPower" - The item's pickaxe power.
"AxePower" - The item's axe power.
"HammerPower" - The item's hammer power.
"TileBoost" - How much farther the item can reach than normal items.
"HealLife" - How much health the item recovers when used.
"HealMana" - How much mana the item recovers when used.
"UseMana" - Tells how much mana the item consumes upon usage.
"Placeable" - Tells if the item is placeable.
"Ammo" - Tells if the item is ammo.
"Consumable" - Tells if the item is consumable.
"Material" - Tells if the item can be used to craft something.
"Tooltip#" - A tooltip line of the item. # will be 0 for the first line, 1 for the second, etc.
"EtherianManaWarning" - Warning about how the item can't be used without Etherian Mana until the Eternia Crystal has been defeated.
"WellFedExpert" - In expert mode, tells that food increases life renegeration.
"BuffTime" - Tells how long the item's buff lasts.
"OneDropLogo" - The One Drop logo for yoyos.This is a specially-marked tooltip line that has no text.
"PrefixDamage" - The damage modifier of the prefix.
"PrefixSpeed" - The usage speed modifier of the prefix.
"PrefixCritChance" - The critical strike chance modifier of the prefix.
"PrefixUseMana" - The mana consumption modifier of the prefix.
"PrefixSize" - The melee size modifier of the prefix.
"PrefixShootSpeed" - The shootSpeed modifier of the prefix.
"PrefixKnockback" - The knockback modifier of the prefix.
"PrefixAccDefense" - The defense modifier of the accessory prefix.
"PrefixAccMaxMana" - The maximum mana modifier of the accessory prefix.
"PrefixAccCritChance" - The critical strike chance modifier of the accessory prefix.
"PrefixAccDamage" - The damage modifier of the accessory prefix.
"PrefixAccMoveSpeed" - The movement speed modifier of the accessory prefix.
"PrefixAccMeleeSpeed" - The melee speed modifier of the accessory prefix.
"SetBonus" - The set bonus description of the armor set.
"Expert" - Tells whether the item is from expert-mode.
"SpecialPrice" - Tells the alternate currency price of an item.
"Price" - Tells the price of an item.
